Reviews.Title: “SLOW Internet”
Reviews.Author: GovtCatalyst
Reviews.Content: FYI - If you need high speed Internet service, DO NOT choose Hotel 71. Nice hotel, but wouldn't recommend it for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Poor Design”
Reviews.Author: superkathy
Reviews.Content: There really isn't anything "wrong" about this hotel, but there isn't anything right about it, either. I went to Chicago for a conference and because of its central location and affordable price, we decided to stay here. It is located next to the river in downtown Chicago, within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. The view of the rooms are good, too. HOWEVER, I must say this hotel is really really poorly designed. When you walk into the room you'll see the bed right next to the door which means you WILL hear people talk in the hall way. You can also hear people next door talking on the phone and can hear pretty much every single word they are saying. The closet is literally tiny and can fit maybe 3 hangers. The closet door is a mirror which is nice, but there is no light in front of it!!! Be prepared to look at yourself in the mirror in the dark... The bathroom is also very poorly designed - the toilet paper is located in the back of and far away from the toilet, which means you'd have to really try to reach for it! There is also a weird magnifying mirror hanging right in front of the bathroom mirror and it is quite annoying. There is air conditioning in the room, but it doesn't tell you the temperature of the room. All there is is a button says "lo-high" "warm- cold" and you have to guess where you want it to be. The hotel is nice to provide free internet, but the desk is barely useable because there is no electric outlet to plug in your desktop or cell phone or anything else... I had to charge my phone in the bathroom. When you walk into the room you won't be able to turn on the light because there are no lights in the room, except for 1 desk lamp and 1 floor lamp both located on the other side of the room... so be prepared to walk in the dark across the room to find a light and locate the switch. I am really not a picky person when it comes to hotels and usually am very understanding, but it is just all the small stuff that adds up giving me the impression that this hotel is super poorly designed. They might have tried very hard but really didn't meet customer needs. Sure the location is great and the beds are comfortable, but look how many hotels are around this areas! Location is definitely not their "unique" quality so nobody should say that they recommend this hotel because of the location. Most hotels around here also have great customer service so that is not a winner, either. Like I said before, it is the small things that make a difference, and it is too bad that they failed.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Roadhemi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights and I slept very well. Beds are great, my room was spacious with a fine river view. Lots of drinking and dining options within a 5 minute walk. Staff were helpful and on a good mood. Well trained or good hiring ? Valet parking is expensive though.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 71 - Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AnnMS62
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. I highly recommend this hotel. The beds were super comfortable and the room was quiet at night. We had a great time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: mauwildduck
Reviews.Content: We(4 family adults) spent couple nights at Hotel 71 end of Feb. We had requested adjoining rooms, so when got to our rooms, realized they were not adjoining. Ben(front desk) was so nice and found us adjoining rooms that turned out to be riverside, rather than cityside. What a view!!! Rooms were large and beds very comfortable. Ben also assisted us in places to eat, etc. We walked most everywhere. Easy trip on train from Midway, and short walk to hotel. Would love to go back and have same rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: sblyden
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in this beautiful hotel and enjoyed every minute of it. Our room located on the 25th floor gave us a wonderful view of the Chicago River. This was my kids first time seeing snow fall, so the river was a nice backdrop. Two minor drawbacks: no soda vending machines and the toilet paper seemed a little cheap for such a nice hotel. Also, if you want a refrigerator make sure you request it. Not all rooms have them. The front desk clerks were warm and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern rooms, helpful staff, close to CBD”
Reviews.Author: AussieSK
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel 71 on the web. Upon arrival--it was our first stop after 30 hours travelling from Australia--it was an inviting and friendly place to stay. We took a shuttle bus from O'Hare airport but took a cab back when we left for New York. Cab was faster and direct--didn't have to do the shuttle hop from hotel to hotel--and not that much more expensive. Our room was on the 37th floor. Really comfortable and recently re-decorated. Coffee machine in the room--not great but palatable--what do you expect from a coffee machine. Great view to the Chicago River and Michigan Avenue and the Hancock Building in the distance. It was within leisurely walking distance of the shops and attractions on Michigan Avenue and a couple of blocks from downtown Chicago and Millenium Park. Staff were friendly, giving us directions to the Green Mill on the northside, arranging cabs, giving an idea of cab fares and info about places to eat in the vicinity. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view. Nice staff just don't get a room by the elevator.”
Reviews.Author: Upnorthtransplant1
Reviews.Content: Super location and view. Staff super friendly. Room nice, bathroom could use an upgrade. No mini bar a bummer. We had a room by the elevator. Super loud as were the guests staying on the floor that night. Not the hotels fault though. If you drive don't park at the hotel garage. A ripoff. Park in the lot next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Malotte
Reviews.Content: We had a river view double queen bed room on the 26th floor. Everything was great, the location, the view, the beds, the staff and the food from Hoyt's restaurant. (The lamb burger was the best burger we've ever had.) Tip: Go up to the ballroom on the 39th floor for a magnificent 360 degrees view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: lu_biancooooo
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice view, great location, very nice and comfortable hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location, beautiful views Great service, perfect location, beautiful view”
Reviews.Author: Prashanth C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 4th anniversary. I booked this based on TripAdvisor reviews, and the rating is completely justified. When I asked them if they had an anniversary package over the phone, they said they didn't do anything like that, but at check in time, they upgraded us to a beautiful Deluxe View King Size room, facing the River, 2 levels above what we booked. There was also a nice bottle of Merlot waiting for us in the room when we entered. As for service, housekeeping and room service was always spot on with our requests and the concierge was very good with his recommendations for dinner and brunch, didn't try to push the restaurant on premises, to us. The location is pretty much the best in Chicago downtown - stone's throw from the Magnificent Mile, facing the River and less than half a mile away from the best restaurants, nightlife and attractions in town. Even though I live in a suburb of Chicago and stayed here for the weekend, I think it was completely worth it, and more. Not to mention, they extended our check out by a couple of hours. Would recommend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: liselv
Reviews.Content: Huge rooms with a huge bathroom, great view and great helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “great location/great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Gina N
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend to Chicago for 4 nights to see a concert and Bulls game as a birthday present. Let me start by saying that my boyfriend is a huge Batman (especially the new Christian Bale movies) fan and I knew the Dark Knight was filmed in Chicago. So I researched filming locations, and ended up learning that Bruce Wayne's penthouse in the movie is the penthouse of Hotel 71. After reading more about the hotel, it seemed to also be a great choice in terms of location and value. I originally booked a Deluxe River King View room but when we arrived, the concierge asked if we wanted to upgrade to a Premier River King View (where we would be on the high floors) for $80 more. I'm a sucker for a good view, so I agreed and we upgraded. I'm glad we did because there can't be a more perfect view of Chicago's downtown. The only thing I have to say is the room still was very small, which I thought was weird because we upgraded to one of the most expensive rooms besides the penthouse. But we were in Chicago to sight-see so we didn't plan on spending too much time in the room anyway. Everyone at the hotel was very nice and accommodating. I asked concierge if it would be possible for us to go up to the penthouse floor because my boyfriend was such a fan of the movie. He set something up for us later in the day when hotel security was available to escort us upstairs for a brief tour. Out of everything I planned for the few days, I think that was my boyfriend's favorite part of the trip and I am very thankful to the hotel staff for making that happen for us. Overall, the hotel is in a great location, has great views of Chicago, and a very friendly, accommodating staff at a reasonable price. When we return to Chicago, we plan at staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: NMPate
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for a large convention and looking for something more reasonable than the large hotels by the convention center. Hotel 71 was a good location and within walking distance of restaurants and shopping and convenient to the L. It was a short cab ride to the convention center (about $10 each way) but with the difference in room charge (compared to near the convention center) that was reasonable and we still came out ahead. Our room was on the less expensive City view side but was quiet, spacious and comfortable in all respects. There were two large comfortable chairs and a large desk. The front desk was always friendly and helpful. There was an empty space in the bureau for a refrigerator and that is the only thing I'd like to see added to the room. I definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: akunkel96
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few nights throughtout the week. It was a great location. We had a nice river view. Our rooms were spacious. There is a nice coffee shop around the corner where we had our breakfasts. We were here to enjoy the city, we didn't spend much time in the room. It was quiet in the room, we didn't hear our neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at 71! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Wkollman
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were checked in swiftly. The staff was extremely friendly and provided directions through the hotel with Ease. Our room was a very good size. We stayed in a premiere city view. We didn't have much of a view but honestly we weren't looking for one. The bathroom was of great size with a huge shower! LOVED the bathroom. LOVED the bed. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have stayed in. Coffee was available via the Keurig which was excellent. The location rocked. Right off the river and pretty central to the city. We did not eat or drink at the hotel. The only reason this hotel didn't get an excellent rating from me was because their lack or size lobby/pool/. I know that sounds kind of crappy of me but I felt cramped with everyone checking in or out along with the bell men. Great for business travel. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Reg_Daphne
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel... the location was perfect!!! The view was spectacular!! Our room was spacious, a good size clean bathroom with a basic tub and a large vanity and great lighting. We had a sofa, a desk and chair a flat screen tv... keurig coffee maker and king size bed. The service at the front desk was prompt and friendly and the door man came to our aid with an umbrella on our rainy arrival. There is a bakery two minutes away for breakfast and across the street you can walk down to the river and sit at cafe and have a drink after dinner. The location was central and close enough to the train, around the corner from the Magnificent Mile and a twenty minute walk to the "Bean". I would stay here again and again and again.

Reviews.Title: “great service great stay”
Reviews.Author: christineinwisconsin
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful finding places we wanted to go to and suggesting other places we would like.Beds were super comfortable and great bedding and pillows.Great sized room.Loved everything about it.We got a great price through a hotwire deal.Would definetly stay here again.A short walk over a bridge to Michigan Avenue.We parked at a Public Parking lot right next to Hotel 71,it was much cheaper than the hotel's lot.It was well lit,but only manned from about 6am until about 5pm,but you can get to your car any time of day.We loved this place,would definetly recommend this hotel.It was a trip with my 2 daughters,age 12 and 26 and myself.

Reviews.Title: “The beds, are wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Frank D
Reviews.Content: Four buddies and I were in Chicago for a convention and we wanted to save a little money, so we split a 2 Queen bed room at Hotel 71. Wow, it was great! We drove from Indiana, so we had to pay to park. I think it was $40 plus a tip when they took it and brought it back. Pretty pricey. They were doing something to the parking garage, so my car was parked off site... somewhere... but it came back just as they took it, so no big deal to me. If you drive, it'll be expensive. Check is was perfect. The nice young lady was very smooth and friendly. The room. Wow! Beside the fact that I cheaped out and didn't get a river view, the room was great. The bathroom has like 4 rooms itself and a TV! You just sink into the beds. The pillows are awesome. We were out until about 3 AM, but the sleep I got was fantastic. I loved this room, except the view of the ally and water tower behind the place. I wish I would have got the river view... We didn't go to the pool or workout area, so I have no idea how that stuff is. I can say the decor of the lobby and halls are really nice. I also noticed there were doorbells for the rooms. Nice! Food. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Very expensive. I can't tell you what it runs compared to a normal downtown Chicago breakfast, but I was a bit shocked I was spending $27 on the buffet. That being said, the food was excellent! The scrambled eggs, potatos and sausage links are probably the best I've ever had. No kidding either and I'm a big food guy. The day we checked out, they were filming a comercial for BMW out in front of the hotel. there was a i3 and a i7, which are both concept cars. It was pretty cool to see. The location is also perfect. Right in the middle of everything. I highly recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel on the River”
Reviews.Author: jdm3x
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a number of years ago during the Taste of Chicago in July. Be sure to get a room facing the river - the views are fantastic! The hotel was clean, comfortable and in the perfect location. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allen T
Reviews.Content: Went for work. Very good staff. clean room. Good 3 star hotel. Good Value

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 71 - close to everything you need in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JKlassic
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here several years ago when it was still the Executive House and it has always been one of our favorite Chicago hotels. This was our first trip since it has changed to Hotel 71 and we were not disappointed. Upon check-in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to one of their newly remodeled rooms, which we did for $20/night. We ended up on the 17th floor with an incredible river view (also a small upgrade when I originally made our reservation). The front desk staff was very helpful and check-in and check-out were both very quick. Rooms are a nice size with modern decor. Ours had an interesting little area (size of a walk-in closet) behind the tv wall with a dresser-type console and a Keurig coffee maker. I'm a Keurig fan, so this was a big hit with me. Our supply of 4 K-cups was replenished daily. We also ended up storing our luggage back here as it was more accessible than in the regular closet. Our bathroom was amazing, and I think the best part from spending the extra money for an upgrade. Large bathroom but only one vanity (two would have been nice) but the large, walk-in shower with its rain showerhead and bench were amazing. I ended up taking a shower every morning and evening just to enjoy the incredible shower. We also liked the Tarocco toiletries so much we've located them online and plan to order some for home use. I had a little trouble adjusting the thermostat to our liking, especially since we like our room cool for sleeping. As I tried but couldn't open the windows, I ended up having to turn it way down, which ended up working fine. Nothing wrong with the heat in this place, which is probably a good thing for those cold Chicago winters! Although we didn't use it, the business area behind the lobby was very nice with a few computers for internet access and some complimentary newspapers. Great location - two blocks from the State and Lake subway stop. Close to State Street shopping and the famous Chicago Theatre as well as all of that incredible Michigan Avenue shopping. It might be a little further from some of the Michigan Avenue shops, but the proximity to the subway and State Street, as well as the lack of street noise more than made up for it. Also, closer to Millennium Park (bean sculpture) and the Art Institute. We ate at a variety of restaurants within a few block radius, including Gold Coast Dogs, Elephant & Castle and the Billy Goat Tavern (chee-burger, chee-burger!). All in all, the Hotel 71 a great place for your next trip to Chicago. After all of these years and new owners, it's still our favorite place to stay in Chicago and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the cost for a river view!”
Reviews.Author: bostonaccent
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel 71. The room I was in previously faced a back area with a view of a building and alley. For this stay I was able to upgrade my room to one facing the river on a high floor. I don't usually keep the curtains open but I did on this stay. The view is awesome! I didn't spend a lot of time in the room but the view was a nice backdrop for when I was in there. Well worth the additional cost. I had a good sized room with two beds. The bathroom was quite spacious as well. The location is convenient to public transit and the shopping area. All in all a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “It lived up to expectations.”
Reviews.Author: fivestarlady104
Reviews.Content: I have to thank my fellow reviewers for the great pictures! The rooms are exactly as displayed on travellers photos that my pics will only be redundant. Kelly at the front desk was exetremely helpful in allowing me to enjoy my birthday. Check in was a breeze and the service is attentive and kind. I requested a high floor facing the river (as suggested by my fellow reviewers) it seems that I'm actually on an angle facing the river with more buildings as my view and I didn't get the high floor I requested (27th floor is where I stayed) but I didn't say anything....this time. I will absolutely recommend staying here again. Note: I actually check out tomorrow but I dont think I will have to add an addendum to this review. All is very well here at Hotel 71.

Reviews.Title: “THE view”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller360
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up for the Hotel 71! Make sure you book a Riverview Room because that vista will blow you away. With that comes the perfect location just off Michigan Avenue, close to shops, restaurants, bars and so on. Really great! I was also glad to see that despite the size of the hotel and the workload during rush hours Front Office staff always stayed very kind and helpful. Housekeeping did a great job, too. The room category I stayed in would definitely need some refurbishment. However you tend not to think about that when you stare at the beautiful lights of the Trump Tower and the Wrigley Building.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Clean and Modern - Great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: debra_h68
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and modern and very nice. The location was outstanding - my favorite of the 10+ hotels that I have visited in downtown Chicago. Also, there were none of the extra costs that you sometimes see in hotels - Internet was free, I had a package delivered at no cost.. My only comments (which I also shared with the hotel management) related to women travellers who have needs that are different than men. There was a big modern shower, no bathtub...A chain on the door would have been nice ...No makeup mirror...No full length mirror in the room...Too many sports channels on TV...Addressing those small issues would have made the hotel perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for overnight business”
Reviews.Author: kyle10014
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very reasonably priced (by my standards at least), and well kept, this was ideal for an overnight business trip. Friendly staff. Good in-house restaurant (tad pricey for breakfast). Have recommended it to friends. Would stay again. Nice views from upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great balance”
Reviews.Author: criticalicious
Reviews.Content: In town quarterly for business...2 nights per trip. Need balance between business in loop area and mag mile fun/best restaurants. Hotel 71 is walking distance to/from both. Also, the experience was seamless. 71's decor is neutral/pleasing, hotel is clean. Views were terrific. Did not eat at the restaurant but there are loads of options close by. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, magnificent view”
Reviews.Author: normafernandez
Reviews.Content: I picked Hotel 71 thru internet search, because it was near Lake Clark station coming from Ohare airport by train. It was a pleasant surprise to see that the room I have chosen by internet in a high floor with view to the Chicago River was really comfortable and it had a wonderful view to the Chicago River and the magnificent mile buildings. The hotel staff was very helpful and the room was ready although it was earlier than check in time. I recommend the location because it is nearby magnificent mile and also the theater and shopping areas (MacyÂ´s, Sears).

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: MickMalizia
Reviews.Content: Whenever you travel to Chicago it is a must to stay at Hotel 71, view, service, rooms are the best not to mention the restaurant Hoyt's in the hotel. The mac 'n cheese with truffle oil and prosciutto is to die for!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “holiday shopping weekend”
Reviews.Author: xtmski
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised at how large and up to date the room was. We had a beautiful view of the river and Trump tower. A terrific value for the price. The only downfall was that the phone did not work and our tv had some issues. This was one of the renovated rooms and it was very nice. The bathroom was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location and staff.”
Reviews.Author: writegirl7
Reviews.Content: Love, love, LOVE this hotel. When traveling to large cities for tradeshows, I'm pretty much expecting higher hotel prices. Still $230/night for what I got was a great deal. Plus, it was on the shuttle route to McCormick Place. The regular rooms were booked and since it was getting close to show time, I upgraded to the junior executive suite for only $20 more a night than the regular room. Couple that with a 20% discount for pre-paying and it was a pretty good deal. Posh interior, working elevators with low wait times and generally really nice looking. The suite had a wet bar and fridge, very nice lounge/desk area, huge sleeping area with chaise lounge and a phenomenal bathroom. Garden tub + seperate shower with rain head - LOVED it. Hotel 71 is close to EVERYTHING. Seriously, the best location. The river is across the street, the Tribune building just to the right and fantastic architecture all around. Nice little restaurant/bar extended off the lobby and an array of food/drink choices all around. The staff was super friendly and my room was fantastic. I will say I can see how others reviewers may be irritated with the thermostat - I had it set on cool for the most part but I'm pretty sure it stayed the same temperature the entire time. It was comfortable for me, but I can how others might find it a bit stuffy. The business center was a little on the small side, but had everything I needed and everything worked. I'd definitely recommend this place for business or pleasure and will for stay again the next time I'm downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The location and the staff really make this an excellent hotel, but be sure to request an updated room.”
Reviews.Author: k9runner
Reviews.Content: They are currently renovating, unfortunately we ended up with a room that had not yet been renovated and it was very apparent. The wall paper was peeling and actually had a few tiny pieces missing, paint on the door frames was peeling off and cracking, grout in the bathroom was black with age and the ceiling needed to be scraped and repainted. Also, when we arrived there were two wine glasses in the hallway outside our room, they remained there for a full day before someone moved them down the hall and set them in front of the service elevator with other room service items that had been by the elevator when we arrived. The two glasses and the other room service items sat in front of the service elevator for the remainder of our stay (over 48 hours). So why did I give a 4-star rating? The staff and location really are excellent and for Chicago the rates are very reasonable. If you get a room on a renovated floor you will be very happy with your stay at Hotel 71.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: bjlemont
Reviews.Content: My friend was ill and the front desk sent us pita crackers and ginger ale with ice! We were so taken care of., we had to request a later check out and No Problem The room was comfy and super cheap with such a great staff! So close to Magnificent Mile and State Street shopping that we really enjoyed the walks! I will so stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Musicmom03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago for a 3 day getaway in November. My internet research showed us that Hotel 71 would be a perfect location for all our needs. Located right on the Chicago River, we paid a bit more for the riverview room, and it was worth it. The views from the upper floors are tremendous. That view became one of my favorite things to photograph. The room was spacious; the bed was comfortable. The in room Keurig made me happy! The staff at the front desk was friendly and accomodating, giving us advice on restaurants and sites, and the best way to get there. From Hotel 71, we walked to everything from the Art Institute of Chicago, the Chicago Architecture River Cruise, Millenium Park, and the Hancock Observatory. You'll be 1 block from the Magnificent Mile, and about 5 from the Chicago Symphony on Michigan Ave. When I go back to Chicago, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “modern & clean, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: maggalena
Reviews.Content: Requested a renovated room on a lower floor and found everything to be perfect for a short stay with my daughter. Nice hotel atmosphere with very courteous staff. No unfortunate surprises so I would definately stay again, especially with the discounted price. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “HOME AWAY FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: emgm76
Reviews.Content: all the comments regarding this hotel are correct - it is a wonderful place ( location too ! ) to really experience chicago. the rooms are spacious, clean and have luxurious sheets that makes it difficult to get out of bed ; ) all questions we had regarding the sites were graciously answered by the front desk and to top it off .... they extended discounts to some of our destinations. thanks to hotel 70 for making my experiences in chicago one i will always cherish

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time was had, Room was AWESOME !!”
Reviews.Author: craigorie
Reviews.Content: Well amenitied room , great price. This Hotel is centrally located to all the desired sites and events. Staff was friendly, and helpful. (If you stay here make sure you get your free Hourdourves coupon at front desk) Elevator can't handle the High volume of people, so the waits can be bothersome. But I would not let this discourage me staying here again. Although I did have to yell at some teenagers to keep it down at 7:30 on Monday morning, We stayed on the 28th floor and had great views.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: virginiagirl83
Reviews.Content: On a trip to Chicago with my mother and daughter, we decided to stay downtown and boy I am glad we did. The Hotel 71 was a fabulous find from other TripAdvisor folks. Took their suggestions to book a corner room and the view was to die for. All advised to eat breakfast next door at a little French cafe, which was certainly worth the price. Excellent service, exceptional accommodations, I would definitely stay here again and hope to in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “I owe Trip Advisor for this one”
Reviews.Author: Tarheelsbred
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for a conference ( not my first vist ) and sought some advice on the Chicago travel forum on hotels that would help me mix a little buisness with pleasure. I intended on getting my brother and sister to join me on the trip - but they never got their act together. So I ended up traveling solo. I usually ( because of just pure laziness and the prospect of accumulating points) stay with Marriott, but I decided to take a leap of faith and try out this boutique-type hotel that offered river views. So very glad I did. .\ First -the view was excellent. Nice large windows to enjoy the view from. The Hotel is situated somewhat perpendicular to the river; So from your river view room you Look down the river as it opens out on the lake gives you such a unique feel to Chicago. Especially at sunrise and sunset. The way the light plays along the streets, river makes it seem as if Chicago has laid a golden carpet out you and only you....and that the city is yours for the taking. I think this is by far this Hotels top selling point. The service was excellent. I booked my room through the hotels website- because they had a special running at the time. I got a Deluxe room ( with two queen beds and river view) for 227/ night during the last week in August. The room was Clean, appeared freshly renovated, more spacious than I expected. I think the catch was that it was a Physically impaired (disabled) -accessible room... but dont let that fool you. You could hardly notice the modifications. Contemporary styling keeps the bars looking as if they are just part of the decor and I did not note this until I was checking out. Of course you cant beat the location. Took one train from midway to the State/Lake station ( 45min ride one way) and had 5 min easy walk to the hotel. Another 5-10 min walk from the hotels steps and I was in a millineum park enjoying a sandwhich and perrier listening to jazz floating through the air from the free summer concert series. Ahh heaven. Loved this hotel so much that when I had to return to Chicago 1 month later. I tried to book it outright and didnt even bother searching for an internet deal...But they were full !!! The horror! No worries though, investigated the closest hotel that offered the same location and thus the same views...... and found the River Hotel next door with slightly cheaper rates- However, in comparison, River Hotel had much smaller rooms and they were missing the nice decor, no friendly doorman, had to wait in a line at the checkout counter. *sigh* Yes, I had been spoiled by Hotel 71 and I probably looked like a jealous lover as rolled my carryon luggage past that day with a huff. But let that speak to Hotel 71's quality and value, not truly anything against River Hotel. Would return to hotel 71 in a heartbeat.... If Hotel 71 would take me back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the river”
Reviews.Author: Itchy-Ban
Reviews.Content: Short weekend stay with my wife. Room was small but comfortable with nice views of the Chicago River and downtown buildings. We walked all over the loop and had a nice visit.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic city & river views”
Reviews.Author: jrwinjapan
Reviews.Content: we got upgraded and had a view of the river, Michigan Ave and downtown. lovely, hip place with great views.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with spectacular views!”
Reviews.Author: BMRCIreland
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my husband in order to see Chicago. What a hotel! What a view we had from the 36th floor (river view). The rooms are huge with a large bathroom. We had 2 Queen beds with super quality bed linen, pillows and towels. We also had a large writing desk and 2 comfortable armchairs. We got a special rate by booking through American Airlines, otherwise it would have been expensive to stay here. Our rate didn't include breakfast but we got a lovely breakfast just beside the hotel at the Corner Bakery. Their prices are very reasonable and they have a very good Europa blend coffee. Hotel 71 is just around the corner from Michigan Ave. We were able to see Chicago on foot (apart from the free trolley to Navy Pier from the junction of State St and Illinois St). I really liked this hotel. It is a a taste of luxury and the staff at reception were more than friendly and helpful to us in answering any of our queries. Our experience here helped to make the entire visit to Chicago that much more special and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Gonzonthemove
Reviews.Content: One of the best locations in Chicago right by the river. There is a seven eleven near by for late night movie rentals (DVD player in room) and for the people who dont use room service for everything. Very clean room and large bathroom with water fall shower head. All of my needs were met and I enjoyed the Hoyt restaurant and bar downstairs. The fitness center was very impressive as well. Bring your work out gear to get a work out with a great river view. My only complaint was no fridge or mini bar but a few buckets of ice fixed that.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I,ve Stayed”
Reviews.Author: mumchie
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 a great place to stay very close to all attractions lovely situation on the river.Very pleasant and helpful staff.Enjoyed my stay immensly.Windows can be opened to let in fresh air not like the New York hotel we stayed in very stuffy with the air conditioning ...If going to Chicago stay here.Also found a great diner on Clarke st Ronneys Steak House very reasonable and great eggs and bacon

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Janell V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 71 for four nights during a business trip. Great location! Friendly staff. I upgraded to a newly renovated room on the 18th floor, river view- and what a spectacular view! The room was clean and spacious. The newly renovated bathroom had a leak in the ceiling above the shower and on my last morning there was no hot water in my shower. The staff was not to concerned with this which made me a little angry - but I was on my way out and found the hotel to be a great value for my stay. The only other complain is a noisy hallway. Not much soundproofing in the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best place around”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: Our second visit in two years, and the place is still tops. The location is still excellent, across a bridge from the super Trump Tower. Reception with a genuine welcoming smile. One of the best anywhere in the world. A current $ 15 million renovation makes everything even more attractive. Free Wi-Fi in the entire hotel. A well-equipped free business center. A room on the river-side offers an almost overwhelming panorama view up and down the river day and night. The room is inviting, spacious, bright, and well-laid out. Ours even had environmentally-friendly electricity-saving CFL bulbs. Bravo. Ours could stand a coffee table in front of a couch. Everythingâ€™s clean and shiny. Great, friendly staff all around. We passed out more little Hawaiian gifts than anywhere else. The troops seem happy, a sign of a well-run operation. They just installed a new restaurant, Hoytâ€™s. Unexpectedly good food, great drinks and really good serviceâ€”but no ambiance. Weather permitting, sit outside, cocktail glass in hand and watch Chicago go by. We want to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View & Location”
Reviews.Author: mrf1153
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 was surprisingly nice and in a great location to all Michigan Ave attractions. I was in town for a convention and this hotel was as nice or better than most of the "convention" recommended locations.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Chai R
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, especially for the price I paid while staying in downtown Chicago. Everyone was very helpful, especially Diane Pena.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trumpy82
Reviews.Content: The location was great, just across the River from all the Michigan Ave. stores. You could pick up the water taxi very easily. Close to state street also. We were on the top floor and the room was amazing. The hotel is undergoing a renovation and unfortunately our room was pre-renovation. The room wasn't bad at all but the bathroom was due for an update. The shower facet was leaky, overall it wasn't bad- it just didn't look like the newly renovated pictures on their website. The elevator system need an update too, the elevators were old and blocked off 2 per group of floors. At one point my boyfriend got stuck in line waiting for an elevator that was lined from the lobby. We had a drink & snack at the bar, it was nice. Bartenders were super nice. Parking was typical of Chicago, $45 a night. Expensive, but normal for the city. We live very close to Chicago, location was very nice. If the price was right, I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and a great stay”
Reviews.Author: LHearne
Reviews.Content: Centrally located... within easy walking distance of the "el". Spacious room on the 34th floor, with views toward the Carbon and Carbide building and other architectural treats. Everything in the room functioned well. Staff were very friendly! It was a very busy weekend at the hotel, and everyone was smiling and in good spirits. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service and a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJWorldtraveler
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located, just steps away from Michigan Avenue and all of its attractions. Few blocks away from Millenium Park and minutes away from all shops in the main area of Chicago. Great service, excellent restaurant a very comfortable big rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: debdana
Reviews.Content: We booked a river view room. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to one of their newer rooms on the 16th floor. Very large, nice room. Great view of the Chicago River. Clean. Just off Michigan Avenue. Within walking distance of Navy Pier, Sears/Willis Tower, Millenium Park, John Hancock Bldg. We had lunch twice in the hotel restaurant, at a sidewalk table. Very good. Only complaints would be dim lighting in bathroom, no refrigerator and noise from the hallway was annoying a few times late at night.

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel w/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JLC124
Reviews.Content: There are a few good things about this hotel.... location, location, & location. It is close to shopping, the river walk, water taxis, etc. However, the room was only so-so. Great view of the river, but needed some TLC. The bathtub had apparently been painted (used to be blue!) and was peeling. The shower head had a loose part, shower curtain rings broken, and the carpet had a burn mark. If you decide to stay here, the first thing you want to ask at the desk is, "Is this room near the elevator?" We spent 2 nights in Room 3801 next to the elevator. I'm assuming the elevator is old because it clunked and bonged all night long. I am one of those people who unpack everything and didn't want to move all my stuff for only one additional night's stay, so tolerated it the 2nd night. When I was checking out I found it very interesting that the clerk did not ask how my stay was, while the person checking out next to me was asked by the other clerk. I'm sure they don't bother to ask those who got stuck in an "elevator room."

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: weephil76
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Stayed here 4 nights. Really fast and friendly staff, lovely rooms and absolutely massive too. This hotel is pretty great for shopping as your almost right on the bridge at one end of the magnificent mile. Never ate here so can't judge food. Staff were really helpful although one was trying to hard was obviously new and was telling us innacurate info. Only downside was smell in bathroom. Would def recommend though.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RoinAZ89
Reviews.Content: My (MN) daughter and I (AZ) enjoyed our stay and are planning to book again for next fall. We had a river view room and being a desert dweller I enjoyed the lights at night. The room was very clean, front desk staff very nice. Our bath did not have a magnifying mrror and the lights could have been brighter. The beds were comfortable and well appointed. We enjoyed the complimetary wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: Audrey L
Reviews.Content: Hi from Dallas, Texas, Stayed at Hotel 71 in Downtown Chicago September 28-30, 2011. I would not suggest staying at Hotel 71. My room had a very smell and the room view was awful, it was over looking some garbage dumpsters. The Trump Hotel was full. So, the event conference coordinator recommended Hotel 71. I will never stay there again. They do not serve complimentary breakfast or coffee. The Hotel did not do anything to suggest they cared if I felt welcomed or they wanted a return visit from me. Also, when the cab dropped me off in front of the lobby, the doorman kept on smoking his cigarette as though I was invisible. The next time I am in Chicago downtown, I will make sure I stay at the Trump Hotel or the Westin Hotel, never at Hotel 71

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: hareparklane
Reviews.Content: Lovely view down the Chicago River from rooms on the roadside. Location is great - across the bridge to the shopping area and close to the business district. Staff v helpful,although they did check me into a smoking room to begin with - rapidly rectified. The lobby area and adjoining bar-restaurant was good if too chilled - the aircon was up too high. Compliemntary wifi worked well. The only downside was a slightly tired bedroom. Comfortable but in need of some refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: Kayaksnbeer
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 is a nice hotel with a great location. Everyone from the front entrance to house keeping were extremely nice. But, a few things. Not all rooms look like the ones on the web site so beware. We booked a city view king bed on a higher floor. The room we were given had a broken dresser, clogged tub, shower curtain with a dirty water ring on it. We were not pleased. My wife complained and were given a different room that was great. Rain shower, the whole works. Recently remodeled. Though I do not watch much TV, if they say HDTV on the web site they should than have HDTV. Simply having a TV that can show HD doesn't mean you have HD. Reception and picture was poor. Would have given it a 4 if it would have not been for our room the first night. Will stay there again but will specify a newer room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice lobby . . so, so, rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mia G
Reviews.Content: As is the fate of many older hotels in large cities, it seems that the Hotel 71 is another case where a new owner buys an older, tired property, invests heavily in the lobby/common areas to give the hotel the appearance of a modern, well-appointed facility then, does as little as possible in the actual guest rooms to make them livable. Clearly the rooms have had some minimal updates (bedding, TV, throw pillows) but . . thatâ€™s about it. The rest of the room is still worn, pealing, dented, flickering lights, old plumbing fixtures etc. The rooms are fairly clean and functional, but itâ€™s obvious that the vast majority of the updates the hotel received went into the lobby. The hotel has a nicely appointed and well equipped exercise room which is a plus. Considering the rate, and if you donâ€™t get too swept up in the ambiance of the lobby, for a downtown Chicago hotel, it is quite reasonable albeit not quite as nice as you might expect from your first impressions when you walk in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - but very noisy room!”
Reviews.Author: Mollyg3IN
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, my husband and I departed for a three night trip to Chicago. Our hotel of choice - Hotel 71. While sometimes I book our rooms through sites such as priceline and expedia; I choose to book direct for this trip in order to ensure we would have a nice room with a great view, etc. We paid 246 a night, which I thought seemed a tad high for this place, but I was willing to give it a shot. We had a superior king room with the river view. The good: very spacious room, beautiful view, double vanities, lots of countertop surface to set things, comfortable bed. The bad: paper thin walls and tiled entry into room made noises throughout seem very loud and it was difficult to get a good night sleep. Couple this with hammering and the constant sawing from a chop saw for two mornings in a row across from our room made the beginning of what was suppose to be relaxing weekend away from construction noise (my husband and I both work in the construction field) not so relaxing. The jack hammering as we waited for the elevator in the lobby and other various noises from the room above ours we thought finally warranted a call to the front desk. 1000 spent at this hotel on room and parking. I never did get to awaken a single morning there peacefully. And how did they offer to make this right? A free breakfast on Sunday. Sunday, I couldn't wait leave. I really wanted to like this place and write more about some of nice features. However, the lack of sleep has proven me grumpy and very disappointed. I probably won't stay here again and most likely will not recommend this place to our friends that frequent Chicago quiet often.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to discover Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bzinsc
Reviews.Content: Located at the river north of the Loop and adjacent to the Magnificient Mile it is the perfect location to discover almost all of the points of interest and scenic sights when you are in Chicago as a tourist. Everything is easily in walking distance or by a short hop with the taxi. Take a room with a river view, it's worth it. The hotel after renovation is modern in the public areas, rooms are clean and well furnished but not luxurious. I was missing an extra mirror for shaving or cosmetics in the bathroom and the closet in the bathroom is somewhat odd. The staff is helpful and very welcoming. The Hoyer-Restaurant has a nice outside seating area with heaters, having wine and appetizers while watching the passing people and traffic.It also serves breakfast buffet which is too expensive and adds a mandatory 20% service fee which is completely unjustified because you have to serve yourself. Better walk 80 yards to the Corner Bakery whre you get it for a third of the price. As said, the location is the best reason to stay there but it is also a good place when you don't want to spend too much. I would stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for tourists”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl1177
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline and was very pleased with the location and room. The hotel is undergoing a renovation and it appears that the rooms have not been completely redone yet, but they are simply a bit dated. The bed was very comfortable and the room exceptionally clean. Staff was extremely helpful and welcoming. As a tourist, you can't beat the location of the hotel. It's close to the tour bus stop, launching point for boat tours and all other forms of transportation around the city. This isn't the fanciest or trendiest place, but it's a good choice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, location and views!!”
Reviews.Author: dadair6
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Hotel 71 and couldn't have been happier. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. We arrived earlier than anticipated and our room was not ready. Kelly at the front desk checked us in, held our luggage for us and took our phone number to call us when the room was ready. By doing so, it allowed us to get something to eat and enjoy the beautiful weather Chicago was having. Once we returned to the hotel we received our keys at the front desk from Ben and he had our bags sent up for us. Kelly also provided helpful information on the different boat tours offered in the city. The room was spacious with beautiful views of the Chicago River. The hotel is just off of Michigan Avenue and located close to the Loop and the Theatre District. Every staff memeber we encountered were pleasant and always seemed to have a smile on their faces. The rate we paid was around half of what other riverside hotels were charging for the same dates. One very minor inconvenience we encountered was related to the elevators. It appeared the hotel didn't have a service elevator and twice we were unable to get on the elevator because staff members and their equipment took up all of the room in the elevator. However, there were also a couple times where staff members exited the elevator so we and other hotel guests could enter. Overall, we were extrememly happy with our stay and will definitely stay again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Walked everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: vyxter
Reviews.Content: Lovely view, clean and pretty room, and the bathroom was really, really lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ColorGuru
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Our room had a lake view and a river view. It is very close to all the attractions. Walking distance to River Cruises, river taxi's, trump tower and Magnificent Mile.The L train is very near to get to Cubs game and we walked (20 min.) from Union Station. I was very pleased with the restaurant as well. Try the fried deviled egg appetizer. The work out facility overlooks Chicago River, very nice. The only complaint I have was lack of storage in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & view”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan612
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room with a fantastic view looking down the river. The location right off Michigan Ave. is perfect - within walking distance to everything. Very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a city hotel for our price.”
Reviews.Author: regina_oc99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in August for 4 nights with a two year old. The hotel was clean, friendly, spacious, and perfect location. We booked using Priceline so didn't really have a choice. Was very pleased with the whole experience! We paid $120 a night. They offer an upgrade ($20 more a night) at check in. We didn't take it and honestly had no idea what an upgrade would be needed for. They provided a pack-n-play for our daughter and a room big enough for all of our things. A side note we didn't know this before we booked but Batman- The Dark Night had a scene filled there.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Superbly located, Best view of Chicago ever”
Reviews.Author: VKassardjian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and decent. Although the carpet in the hallway looks old, bathrooms are very modern and clean, and our room was much more spacious that what I would have expected. Ask to get a room that faces the Norh-West: The view of the Chicago river is stunning at every moment of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, excellent location, good value”
Reviews.Author: palmeirense
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here. First let me say we found a great deal (think through kayak) from getaroom.com for 138/night after taxes over the labor day weekend for 3 nights for city view. This was a great value considering the room was large for downtown chicago, very clean, updated when compared to similarly priced old historic hotels we looked at that were said to very cramped on space and a little dingy. Even better we got upgraded to a river view! The location is perfect, right on the river next to Michigan Ave, right across the street from the magnificent Trump Tower, with a great view. Short walk to millineum park, to magnificent mile, to metra especially, to food options, and to architecture boat tour even. Our flight arrived in the morning so we dropped our bags off at the hotel and they tried to find a room for early-check in for us. They didn't call us back until 4pm with a room ready, but they upgraded us to a river-view for free in a large room with a king bed and couch, which we loved. Will definitely be back. Service was great. Only thing that was not top-notch is the bathroom. It was large and updated everywhere except the shower and bath seemed a little old but nothing too bad. Also, there was no minifridge, but I don't think that is expected for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View and Location”
Reviews.Author: everythingflowers
Reviews.Content: This hotel checks all the boxes: - great location (we walked everywhere) - very clean (it is newly renovated) - friendly staff - good price for being in the heart of it all Plus the view was fantastic. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: joxumare
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 is a great location for a short trip to Chicago. Dead center of the city with easy access to everything (including the airports). Was there to attend my cousins wedding which was held in the hotel. Great idea. The service and reception were held in the penthouse with a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “very nice & clean”
Reviews.Author: joisey-joe
Reviews.Content: we wanted a nice, clean hotel for a reasonable price and we got real nice luxury for a very decent price (well for a big city).......save on parking -- there's a lot 2 doors down from the hotel you can park 24 hrs for $28 (cheaper than the hotel's $45) -- the doorman pointed us the way - which was very kind of him (told us the only downside was no in & out privledges - but that was fine with us) - all in all a good stay

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: JPDucks
Reviews.Content: We (my Wife, 3 month old and I) just got home from our 3 night stay at Hotel 71 and overall we really enjoyed the experience. We had a corner room (not one of the City View rooms) and the room still had a view of the Chicago River which was a nice treat. Iâ€™m not sure how much this hotel would normally cost but we purchased a Groupon a while back so we paid $99 a night and it was well worth it. The major pluses were: The hotel is centrally located, right next to the loop, a block away from Michigan Avenue and a short walk to Millennium Park and most of the other major attractions. Now for the downsides: The parking lot is currently undergoing a renovation and you have to wait up to 20 minutes for the valet to bring your car. Itâ€™s not a big deal if you plan ahead and call before you need the car but I donâ€™t think the hotel should still be charging their normal $45 a day parking rate right now. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at Hotel 71 and would definitely stay here again, with or without a Groupon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, maybe a little pricey to justify a return visit”
Reviews.Author: JulieATurner
Reviews.Content: I am a budget traveler. We actually spent the first part of this trip staying with friends outside of the city. But we wanted our last night in Chicago to be special, so we booked at room at Hotel 71. I have been to Chicago several times before, but my husband hadn't. We were both thoroughly impressed by the view of the city from the hotel. It was beautiful. Our room was clean and modern. The bed was comfortable, and although we didn't use it (because there was an Intelligentsia coffee shop nearby), the room had a Keurig coffee maker, which I appreciated. The hotel staff were incredibly accommodating, as we needed to leave our luggage for 5 hours after check out. As far as price goes, I am not used to spending $200 on luxury hotels. We actually used the Hotel Tonight iphone app to find a great deal on this hotel, although I think the price would have been the same booking directly through the hotel website. I would definitely stay here again if I had the opportunity to head back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Views”
Reviews.Author: jaydub80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a three day weekend trip to Chicago. Got a special rate from TravelZoo. The hotel is in a GREAT location, right on the river and very convenient to most of the sights in Chicago. We got a room overlooking the river, which was beautiful. The room was clean and the bathroom was huge. The shower was very nice as well. My only slight complaint was that we were next to the elevator shaft. You could NOT hear the elevator from our room, but you could hear the people congregating next to the elevator waiting for it. I would DEFINITELY recommend and I will be back when I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: jakoss
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a Mother/Daughter girls weekend in Chicago and were very glad we did. The hotel was very clean and even though we arrived at the hotel early in the day, they had a room were were able to check into. We decided to upgrade to a river view for a few dollars more and were very glad we did. The view was fantastic! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. When we left to go out for the day after our first night there, the room was cleaned promptly. When ever we called for something like an extra towel, they were quick to respond. The location is central to everything. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and location”
Reviews.Author: edcm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The 'public parking' entrance directly next to the front door was very misleading, we pulled up expecting to park ourselves but it was not in service. Valet parking at $45 for 24 hr, not sure where they put our car. The riverview room was outstanding and a perfect location. If you stay closer to the bottom of hotel (near 15th or so) the view will be remarkable and low enough to see the boats close on the river. The hotel is close to everything! We walked everywhere we needed to go (couldn't probably do that with small children). Went to Navy Pier (awesome), walked Michigan Ave. and Millenium Park is two blocks. Would stay here again for sure. It was a little pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A really great little hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: This is a really great hotel for business or pleasure in Chicago. Location is great, right on the river at the top of the Golden Mile. You can easily walk to the shops, restaurants, bars and the lake. Everything else is an easy cab ride. Ask for a river view but not next to the elivators (which are noisy). Rooms are very pleasant. Service was always very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Best Location”
Reviews.Author: kio607
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for me and my boss for an event at the Navy Pier and I must say thet the staff from the minute you arrive are very accomodating. The rooms are very nice and have some great views. I was in a situation where I lost my wallet in a cab and someone who was staying at the hotel found it in the cab, The front sdesk called me while I was at the pier and notified me immediately and held my wallet until I was done working for the day. House keeping and doormen were exceptionally friendly and the restaurant was fantastic..... Try the Chocolate jar for dessert. My only negative was small elevator and waiting for the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Phantom0316
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here in late July and could not have been more pleased. The room was very clean and well appointed with a great view of the Chicago River and downtown. The staff was courteous and helpful throughout our stay and the location couldn't be better. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Clean, large, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Outlawa
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here before. The room we had (at a discount) wasn't the best they could offer. But I really wasn't expecting the best for the reduced price I paid. With that said, the room was still very large with an equally large bathroom and closet space as well. The beds were very comfortable and the staff was friendly. The walls seem to be a bit on the thin side, but nobody on our floor was making lots of noise, so there was no problems with sound. It seems some work was being done (during the day) on lower Wacker under the hotel. The sound traveled through the entire hotel as I could hear it on the 31st floor were I was staying. The central location of the hotel gives you easy acces to public transportation, water taxis, and walking to most locations. Because of this, I left the car in Iowa and took the train into Chicago. I did not miss the car at all and was able to easily get to every place I wanted to go in about the same amount of time it would have taken to drive and for less money considering I didn't have to pay for parking at different locations. Some things that I could nit-pick about the hotel: If you looked hard enough you could find were a few corners had been cut on renovating the room. The thin walls and doors (as I mentioned earlier). A corner of wallpaper that was loose here and there. Fast busy when trying to call the front desk on two separate mornings. And one day (out of 4) when room service kind of skimmed over the room instead of actually cleaning it. None of these were deal breakers and didn't take away from what I considered a very good experience with the hotel. I would have no problem with, and look forward to, staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: mrpcok
Reviews.Content: We really had a great time here, the hotel was central and the staff extremely helpful, I would highly recommend and hope to return, some great shopping and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “A place to be”
Reviews.Author: J0j0_Liege
Reviews.Content: very good location, spacious bedrooms the personal are friendly and the food is very good too possibility to do fitness and sport to recommend if you stay to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation!”
Reviews.Author: ProfPayne
Reviews.Content: Hadn't stayed here in several years and what a beautiful renovation! We were upgraded to a beautiful room with a city view. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: Karen T
Reviews.Content: Nothing but praise for this hotel and their staff, especially for 2 employees: Suheyb & Jillian. When printer was not working properly, they took charge and made sure that I and another guest (that I did not know) got what we needed fast. The hotel is in the BEST location for everything you want to do in Chicago. The rooms are clean, spacious, and the one we stayed in very updated. The linens and bed were so comfortable. Also, the bellmen were EXCELLENT! Very friendly and most helpful, even getting us umbrellas, when it was raining to walk to a restaurant near by. We will only be staying at Hotel 71 when we return to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: tranman387
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple nights on American Express points while visiting the Chicago for the first time. I cannot stress how amazing the location is. Hotel 71 is right across from the Trump tower and the iconic "beehive" buildings. It's right on the river where we were able to take the Chicago Architecture Foundation's boat tour (highly recommended). It's within minutes walking to Michigan Ave, the Loop, Millennium park, Grant park, Navy Pier, and the beach. You definitely won't need a car staying here. The decor and design is very trendy and stylish. I'd highly recommend Hotel 71 to anybody visiting Chicago. Also, splurge a bit and get a river-view room, it's worth it! Pros: LOCATION (can't beat it) Best hotel gym I've ever seen (huge and all top of the line equipment) Helpful and friendly hotel staff Very spacious room and bathroom Amazing view (river-view room) Cons: Bathroom was outdated compared to everything else (especially the shower)

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: lewisdebi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to everything, easy to get to from the el, with friendly staff. I am pretty picky when it comes to hotel rooms, and I cannot think of anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: LLindaC
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Hotwire for the weekend of Lollapallooza. It wasn't THAT great of a deal, but nothing is during that weekend. We got a corner room on the 30th floor which was excellent. We had a great view of the river and the bustling city below. The room was very clean and had a coffee maker. No fridge, microwave or safe. The only real negative- and it's quite bad- is that the doors slam VERY loudly. The walls are somewhat thin and you can hear every thing in the halls. The cleaning staff often talked back and forth at early hours which kept me awake. After the first night, I kept the fan running and white noise on the radio so that I could sleep. The staff was friendly and very helpful. On the last day, they were closing the hotel for maintenance and couldn't store our luggage. They helped us by taking it next door to the Club Quarters. The door man gave me suggestions for the cheapest drinks and gave me a coupon for free apps at a nearby restaurant. (By the way, for cheaper drinks and breakfast, go to the Emerald across the street!) They also had one of the nicest workout rooms I've seen in the city, with two rooms of Life Fitness machines, free weights, mats, etc. The room had wall a/c units which kept the temperature low when the sun was streaming through the windows. The room was on the 7th floor with a nice city view. I would definitely stay here again- the location was great and the staff were wonderful. There is free wifi and there are 3 free computers in the lobby and a printer as well.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: lem c
Reviews.Content: the location is amazing , everything is close and you have bus stop , water taxi and subway just around . The view from the room is unbelievable: bridge , river, tower ..... the room was really nice , warm color and nice detail , really big with a coffee machine ( like a nespresso !) just a but ...... no fridge and the bathroom seems a little updatted compared to the really new and nice room but really it wasn't a pb , the doors seems really thin as we heard a lot of noise from the others rooms . the bed also was incredible good the staff was also really nice , they propose to send our postcards and to keep our luggage for the day in a luggage room with a receipt ( it always a waranty ...) they have printer and pc free access Breakfast are served in the restaurant at the entrance of the hotel , really nice and modern . It's a little bit expensif but good and if you want an other alternative you can find a really good bakery at the corner

Reviews.Title: “Corner rooms=awesome views!”
Reviews.Author: b0cam0m
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Hotel 71 for annual shopping/sightseeing trip to Chicago. Upgraded to river view (corner) room for nominal fee and WOW! What a view! Located on 33rd floor, downtown Chicago at our feet, large room, somewhat smallish bathroom, but very comfortable. Mirrored closet doors came off tracks and we informed front desk, but problem wasn't fixed when we checked out. Walls somewhat thin, Lollapalooza attendees next door very loud! Hotel security called and immediately quieted the situation. Thank you, Hotel 71 for another great Chicago experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Scenic location....amazing service”
Reviews.Author: kimmy8614
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience at this downtown gem. Well worth the price to have a huge room in the heart of the city. Other boutique hotels claim to be the best, but Hotel 71 is the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modern but slow wifi”
Reviews.Author: travel23
Reviews.Content: We scored a great deal on a room at Hotel 71 so decided to make a 3 day mini vacation out of it. The hotel is right on the other side of the river and Michigan Ave is is in walking distance. When you arrive at the hotel they have some lounge style music playing outside and very attentive doormen waiting to help or open a door for you. Check is was quick and efficient and provided us with a map. Be sure to take the correct elevator, they have express elevators to the higher floors 26+. Ice makers are NOT on every floor, only a few select floors. Our room was clean, spacious and modern looking. We booked the basic city view king room and had plenty of room and an animal print sitting couch. The room included a Keurig single serve coffee/tea machine. (included 2 breakfast blend, 1 decaf and 1 green tea pod). The bathroom toiletries were nice, I enjoyed the orange scent of the shampoo and soap. Towel were nice, smelled fresh, shower had great pressure and steady water temps. The wifi at the hotel is very slow, i was getting less than 500k up and down after various speed test through out the day. I finally decided to ask the front desk and they suggested I call the "IT" desk, I called them and they told me they throttle the bandwidth to 512k up/down. That is pretty bogus, you are staying at a business hotel and they can't even offer you a 1mb connection. I would stay here again, great location to the sights, buses, L train ect.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy and will return!”
Reviews.Author: herburlness
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Chicago for the 4th of July weekend. We waited longer than we should have thinking we would of gotten a lower rate on Priceline. I finally accepted that were not going to stay in a 4* for the amount of money we wanted to spend waiting until a few weeks before we left. I did my research and knew it would be between 2 hotels on Priceline. They accepted our bid of little over $100 per night for 4 nights. I visit Chicago frequently, it is my favorite city! I knew where this hotel was and had walked passed it many times. The El was only a couple blocks from the hotel, which is always nice. It was very nice inside and the front desk staff was fantastic! We were on the 34th floor and had a very nice room with a large bathroom. The view of Michigan Ave was a little more to be desired, only because it was blocked by buildings. But didnt stop us from watching a late night thunderstorm from the comfort of our room. The bed was comfortable and the water hot which always makes me very happy! Housekeeping never rushed us and was always very patient no matter how late of a start we got. The location couldnt of been better. You cross the river to your left and you have Rush Street and fantastic bars,restaurants and shopping. To the right your have Millenium and Grant Park, museums, and the Loop....you cant go wrong! Ive stayed at alot of hotels in Chicago. Some I will stay again and some not so much. But this one I felt was a gem. We didnt have any problems or issues and were very happy with our stay! My only con would be that we had to go up two floors every time we wanted ice. But it really wasnt that big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Boffo!!”
Reviews.Author: whosyer12
Reviews.Content: Our new favorite hotel in Chicago. Had a great recent 3 night stay. Absolutely gorgeous river view room. Never much cared before about a room with a view---I do now! What a knockout, wall to wall windows overlooking the river and bridges, the Trump Tower, and those twin tower round condo buildings that they drove the car off of into the river in that old movie. Wow. Room was quiet and comfortable with clean sumptuous furnishings and linens. Large marble bathroom with huge walk-in glass walled shower with bench seat and large overhead "rain" shower head. Free adequate wireless.>Staff was over the top friendly and eager to please. A special request was met quickly and eagerly. Only two slight negatives: elevators are a tad slow. And Sunday breakfast service at the restaurant was non-existent-so we left. Not nearly enough to even think about subtracting a star for though. From reading other reviews--apparently some of the rooms here are not yet updated (as ours must surely was), so until all rooms are experiences may vary. We had a delightful time.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled by look of lobby”
Reviews.Author: jukniukas
Reviews.Content: Yesterday we returned from our short getaway in Chicago. I wish I would be writing a very nice review about this property but unfortunately I am not. The first look when you walk-in to the hotel very impressive: they have nice looking restaurant "Hoyt's Tavern" and nice decorated lobby. Check-in not informative but quick (I noticed this in lots of Chicago hotels not only this one). We were offered a map of the area at the check-in and just later I realized why that was a good gesture - you will want to run out from property when you see your room ... trust me that's how I felt. Nice elevators but when the door opens to your floor - new world opens to you. We stayed on the 36th floor. It was a corner room. The view was spectacular and that's all about what was nice. Carpet in hallway was stained, door to the room was opening very hard and made a loud noise. Room was very dirty: dust on night stands, finger marks on the desk, stained carpet, the chair had white stains, the bedskirt was so dirty that I could not believe what I was seeing. The bathroom was the most outdated bathroom I have ever seen: old tub, grout pinkish, vents very dusty, mirror dirty. If we would of known that what we were seeing online is not matching the reality, we would of never booked. I saw lots of other people's pictures of the rooms and they do not look anything like we had and it was listed as Deluxe River View Room. Maybe we ended up in the section that was not renovated or something like that. This could be an excuse for outdating but I can not find an excuse for dirtiness everywhere. Commenting other postings: Yes, the room doesn't have refrigerator. We slept good because the hotel was empty and no one was making any noise. The staff in The Hoyt's Tavern careless and rude, especially the manager on the night duty on Monday night. He was more involved in flirting and hugging his bartender then caring about his job. We booked "Rise and Dine" package. No one even mentioned this to us at the check-in. Later we stopped by the FD to figure out how that all works with the breakfast, do we need any vouchers for the restaurant and were told just let them know about it and they will give you separate menu to choose from. When we got to the restaurant server did not know anything about the package and said we should of got vouchers. She suggested to charge to the room and discuss about it with the front desk staff. Front desk staff was nice but that's all about. Very disappointed in overall experience and would never go back. I work in hotel business and know better then anyone else that things happen (and that is the reason why I did not made a fit about it) but I know too if you care and you motivate your staff to strive for customer service you would at least ask at the check-out how was your stay. This place definitely needs improvement in management that cares about what they do and property needs serious renovation. Seriously, you can stay in so many better places and it's only going to cost you $$ more. It's worth the money...

Reviews.Title: “Well located but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: Doymo
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 is right in the heart of the Chicago action. The rooms are big and lovely, clean, comfortable beds, and cool in the 90 degree heat. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The only problems were the check-in (rooms still weren't ready at 5PM) and it was extremely noisy. You could hear full conversations in the hallways and other guest room doors opening and closing all night long. There are no sound barriers whatsoever. Would not stay there again for that reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very convenient location on the river”
Reviews.Author: Eileen Joan
Reviews.Content: River cruises very near by. Take a river taxi from michigan ave to navy pier then another one to the museum area. Have breakfast at the Corner Bakery, turn right out from the hotel Reasonable & good. Also go to the big park always something going on. Hotel room on higher floors, good as the view was good . Bathroom was due an upgrade. Chicago a great walking city & plenty to do & see

Reviews.Title: “Winning”
Reviews.Author: kfacpa
Reviews.Content: Ok, it gets 5 stars for location, value ($99 Groupon price) and the BEST HOTEL BED EVAH!!! I'm really picky particularly about the A/C issue I've read about... our room has afternoon facing sun and Voila, A/C worked perfectly keeping us at 68 degrees even though it was moderately hot and humid outside.. The gym facility was pretty good too... we worked out at 1PM so was empty, but can imagine prime time can get crowded, but it was good for us... No restaurant in hotel per se, kinda a bar style place, but wife is from Chicago so we drove to Andersonville and had great breakfast up there.. I don't know what they are using for their beds, but we slept fabulously and that is so important... comfy and supportive... Location right on the river, between Michigan and Wabash so shopping and restaurants are nearby... easy to get to, near Lakeshore.. Winning!
