Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Chicago River views”
Reviews.Author: MrsCsInteriors
Reviews.Content: We reserved this hotel not knowing what it was like, but were very pleased with it and would definitely stay here again. We paid a little higher price to get a room higher up and it was definitely worth it. The view of the Chicago River from our room was like a postcard! I took most of the pictures of Chicago through our window. The bed was very comfortable, bedding excellent, the bathroom and toiletries upscale. The people at the front desk were helpful in suggesting restaurants. I highly recommend Hotel 71.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: Otoh
Reviews.Content: Average in every way. It really didn't make any particular impression on me. The room was enormous though. We had 6 huge bags, so it worked in that respect. The location is excellent. . Easy access to Loop and Magnificent Mile., and near several El lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: pamal100
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Got a great rate with Groupon at $99, $109 for riverfront. Regular price is $179+ .Most comfortable bed and pillows we have ever had. Bathroom tubs need updating- cracked fixture and adding a curved curtain rod would have made it more spacious. Other than that, no complaints at all. We had 2 rooms smack next to the elevators and was worried about noise. Not a sound. Parking $45 a day valet. Restaurant very pricey but very attractive bar and table areas. Breakfast was pretty good. Great location. Our rooms looked directly out to Trump tower and overlooked the river.

Reviews.Title: “Location.”
Reviews.Author: LuckEinLove
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of all the action. Amazing view of the river. Very short walk to access water taxis and river walk. Short walk to the Navy Pier. Great in house restaurant with street level seating. Great for watching the city going by. Rooms are nice. Valet parking right at hotel is very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Goldensmom03
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 71 provided a beautiful upscale hotel in the perfect location for walking Chicago. The Hotel 71 service was 4 star! We had flown overnight and they checked us into our room early so we could get some rest before starting our adventure. The staff helped us with items we had forgotten, directions around town and reservations for dinner. We could not have asked more more gracious assistance. The rooms are large and well appointed. The bathroom was also roomy and had a luxurious feel. The lobby and bar are updated, contemporary without being cold. The only challenge is the expense of parking which is due to the downtown location. They did offer us some less costly options which we appreciated! We cannot wait to go back and we will certainly stay at the Hotel 71 again. Make sure you also walk down Michigan Avenue to the right and visit the brand new popcorn place called Sticky Fingers. The popcorn fits the name but it is delicious and you don't have to wait in line at the more established one down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfortable, well-designed room”
Reviews.Author: Bee72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel 71 for a weekend and thought it was a great place to stay. The location was fantastic, right on the river, a block off of Michigan Avenue. The room was a good size, very clean, with great modern design features. The bed was very comfortable, with nice sheets and lots of pillows. The room featured free wi-fi, a flat screen TV, iPod dock, a coffee/tea maker, a rain shower, nice orange-scented bath products, and best of all, all of the lights were dimmable. There was no perceptible street noise, but noise from the hallway was sometimes a problem. Overall, I thought that this was a good value for a great hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My "Go To Hotel" in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Grandma55
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review now because the movie Transformers 3 just hit the theaters and it was being filmed right outside our hotel when we were there. This was my second time at Hotel 71 the first was booked for me by Amtrak vacations. This time I asked for the hotel after having a bad stay at another hotel in Chicago. I love this hotel the rooms are spacious and clean, the views of the river are beautiful especially at night, the staff is friendly, and the location makes it perfect. I can walk from Hotel 71 to Navy Pier or to Buckingham Fountain it has a nice central location but is not overly priced.

Reviews.Title: “The potential is there. But there could be a lot of improvements”
Reviews.Author: zermas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern, tall and beautiful building. It is located right on the Chicago River and has a beautiful view. The rooms are spacious and the furniture is pretty new. The problem that I had with the hotel started with the upkeeping of it. Soiled sheets. Smelly pillows. Dust bunnies hiding everywhere. It looked like for a long time the cleaning people just vacuumed where it was comfortable for them to clean but didn't make any effort to get the room really clean. The walls and doors are thin. Which means that you will hear your neighbors that are having a fun vacation and your neighbors who are having a terrible time(if you know what I mean) The next problem is the restaurant. Because of the hot weather I ended up dining there twice. The portions are large and they are very attractive. They sure put a lot of thought into presentation. Flavors, however, are a different subject altogether. My medium rare cheeseburger was so dry and the sliders I had the following day were just awful. I stayed up until 4 in the morning trying to digest them. The staff in the restaurant is rude and seemed more interested in flirting with each other than paying attention to customers. I am all for a healthy, happy work environment but if I am choking on that dry burger and need water, I want somebody to pay attention. So altogether this is a good hotel. They just need to work on the cleaning people and fix up the food and service in the restaurant

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but there are better in the area”
Reviews.Author: ExpatTraveler2
Reviews.Content: I'm afraid that my review of this hotel suffers from direct comparison to another Chicago hotel (the Amalfi) where I had stayed just one week prior to my stay at Hotel 71. Both hotels are in essentially the same location (really just across the river from each other) but Hotel 71 was slightly more expensive than the Amalfi and I failed to see why. In fact, even if the price tags were exactly the same, I think I would chose the Amalfi over Hotel 71 in the future. This is not to say that Hotel 71 was not a good hotel, in fact we had a very positive experience there. But the Amalfi seemed to be just a notch above in several areas, which left me wondering why I was paying more money. From reading some of the other Trip Advisor reviews it is likely that I was simply in the yet-to-be-refurbished section of the hotel, but then again, why the higher price? To break it down, Hotel 71 had much nicer views from the windows, and I guess if that is important to you, you should pick this hotel. However, the Amalfi's rooms were more comfortable & up to date (again, this may change soon), had a minibar, bottled water, and fresh cookies in the room upon arrival, and provided complimentary breakfast. The extras at the Amalfi really added up and made Hotel 71 look a bit basic, especially given that I was paying more.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: ModeenW
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through TravelZoo, and we had a very nice stay there. Our room had a huge bath with both a shower and a separate tub - plus two separate sinks. Everything was very clean. The check-in process was very smooth, and our room was available for us even at 1 PM. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but!!”
Reviews.Author: tiredtraveler100
Reviews.Content: Great location but mediocre service. Room service over at 10 pm no mini bar no bottled water-- they tell you to go to the fitness center for it! Bar closes at midnight. Not what I would expect. Hostile response. -you didn't talk to me excuse from front desk Would not recommend for a group and wont come back.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected surprise!”
Reviews.Author: debbill72
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Chicago many times over the years, but never in this area on the river,found a good rate on the chicago Tourism website, and decided to give this place a try.Was pleasently surprised by the lovely modern decor, great service, large room with a lovely marble bath, kitchenette, and a great view of the river. Good location near almost everything, took the water taxi from the train station, and again out to navy pier, it was great, highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: city4ever44
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a fantastic stay at the hotel 71 it is right in the middle of all the attractions and within walking distance of most.Ask for a river veiw room they are great.We cannot praise the hotel enough.A special thanks to i think her name was Ali on reception she is so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One of the good hotels in Chicago downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Rohan
Reviews.Content: First week of June, I stayed a week in Hotel 71, which is located centrally in Chicago just opposite the Huge Trump Tower, the other side of the river. River view was very pleasant and there were many attractions in the close distant. My room was quiet big but there were no signs of refurbishments. When asked, I was told that because the hotel was full I was not in a fully re-furbished room. There was no mini bar or safety deposit box in the room. The bath room was old and basic. Internet was free. Since my stay was for a huge conference in Chicago, all hotels were full and rates were quite high. Ground transport arranged by the hotel was not there on my arrival. All minor things were compensated by the friendly staff at the front desk and good service. Even though I was not in a renovated room, because of the location of the hotel and the friendly service, I can recommend it as one of the good hotels in Chicago downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise in the middle of EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel2345
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute trip to Chicago and booked this room It was an absolute pleasant surprise. It has impeccable service and its in the center of a lot of important places - magnificent mile, river walk, tourist destination. Great place to stay. The breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “The view from my window simply breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: kenshiho
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights due to a congress. I knew nothing about the hotel. This was my second visit to the windy city. The staff was very helpful and nice. When I got to my room my jaw dropped:what a rooom and such a magnificent view from the window. The hotel has great location. The room was large with a kingsized comfy bed. Large TV. Coffee maker. Desk. Internet access. The breakfast was delicious. There was a cook preparing omelets for you. The coffee was beyond words.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cayatana
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Groupon for this hotel which was $109/night for a king riverview room. When we checked in, the staff was very helpful and pleasant. Although a high-rise, you still get the quaint feel of a boutique hotel. The lobby and onsite restaurant (Hoyt) had great modern and comfortable furniture. The room itself had a marvalous view from the 32nd floor. Bed was super comfy, as was the chaise lounge. Like other reviewers said, the walls are a little thin and the bathroom could use some updating (mainly the tub as it was VERY slow to drain after showering), but these things didn't bother me too much to ruin my stay. The staff responded quickly to my request for more towels and I loved having a Keurig in the room. Unfortunately, we had a very busy weekend, so we didn't spend a lot of time there. But I'd love to go back, especially at that price. Few tips: The attached garage is $45/night. But you can park at the open lot right next to the hotel for about $28/night. We parked our car and walked or took the bus wherever we needed to go, and cabbed it when it got too late. But the location is optimal, great for those who want to shop/dine/play on Mag. Mile and come back to their room to rest and/or refuel. Also great locale to reach the parks for the Taste of Chicago or other events. Wish they had a pool, but oh well..the beaches in Chicago are a great substitute. The restaurant at the hotel next door Bacino's also makes a decent deep dish pizza. And try the Corner Bakery (1 min away) or Yolk (5 minute cab/bus ride) for great breakfast alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and a wonderful view”
Reviews.Author: Bettinasgranddad
Reviews.Content: Actually, there is not much to say except that the location and view is very very good. We did not use any facilities except internet and never tried the restaurant in the evening or at lunch. Staff members were polite and friendly. Something interesting happened, though: At checkout we an envelope with information that we should have had at checkin !!?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, average hotel with no complaints.”
Reviews.Author: candice53
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights midweek. Location was good for being in the middle of things and just a two block walk from the orange line station to/from Midway airport. Room was adequate size but I would not consider it big as others have posted. We did have a corner city view room that gave us a decent view of the river. Bed was very comfortable. Bath was fine with great water pressure though water not very hot in my opinion. The air conditioner did work but it didn't cool the room as much as I like (I like it cold). The on premise restaurant, Hoyt's, was busy and seemed popular with a younger crowd. They have comfortable outdoor seating that looked inviting but we didn't get a chance to enjoy it. The restaurant 'Catch 35' is a few blocks away and we really enjoyed their late evening bar menu and the ambiance. We felt the hotel was fine, nothing special. We'll try another of the many hotel choices next time. If you can get a great rate for this hotel though, do it! Travel Zoo is running a summer special for $119( I think) and it's worth that! Oh, and if you're planning on going to the Shedd Aquarium, the desk has tickets for $31 that give you immediate access. We were really glad that we bought them at the hotel. The line was REALLY long on a Tuesday morn and it was really hot out. Well worth the extra money not to have to wait a long time in the heat and waste much of our valuable and brief vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: shiredawn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, beautiful, and the view from our river view room was fabulous! We watched the bridges going up and down for the boats; the Memorial Day parade staging area; the Wrigley Building and Trump Tower; and the city lights. The rooms were huge, and the location can't be beat. Just off Michigan Avenue at Wacker. We walked everywhere and had a great time. The parking was typically high priced but we got a deal on the hotel so it hurt less.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: Starlight70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with our two kids, as they hotel could not accommodate both nights of our stay during a recent road trip. Like just about everything else in Chicago, the prices were steep. We were expecting more for the price we paid, but found only typical accommodations. We liked the location, the friendly and helpful bellhops, the views from our room and the top floor ballroom, and in and out privileges for the parking. We missed not having a mini fridge, and felt that having only one chair in a deluxe room with two queen beds was a miss even though there was plenty of room for more comfortable seating. The valet staff was slow to bring our car at checkout. There were no others waiting, and no new arrivals, yet it took them 20 minutes to get our car to us.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location but just a few tweaks needed”
Reviews.Author: foodiefromupnorth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in middle of June 2011. My partner was in Chicago on business and I tagged along for fun. We had both been to Chicago before. Things I really liked about the hotel: the location was amazing and the view was really nice; the bed was very comfortable; the staff was pleasant and helpful; the business center had a printer which was great for printing boarding passes. Our remote controls never really worked, and the noise level from the hallways was surprising. I found the bathroom wasn't very clean when we arrived (hairs in the bathtub, etc) and we sometimes found certain parts of our deluxe room a little unsavoury smelling. For parking, you do have in-and-out privileges, which is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on the River, close to the Merchandise Mart”
Reviews.Author: SYJUNGLE
Reviews.Content: We were here for the NEOCON show. The rooms are all renovated. We had a Double Queen room that was very large, with separate roomy desk working area. They have a new restuarant/bar which is excellent and with an outside patio looking onto the river. The staff and front desk were all very friendly and efficient. The top floor penthouse function room is huge and was fantastic for a large event. gret views of Chicago and the river. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Blah”
Reviews.Author: jimmyray35
Reviews.Content: Internet speed unacceptable... cannot get my work done. Rooms are underwhelming. Laughably small TV in a big suite room. No glasses. No mini bar. No bottles of water. Service completely lacking on check-in... never greeted or offered help from curb to room. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “More spacious and luxurious than some Chicago "luxury" hotels”
Reviews.Author: iksnezok
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotal that was remodeled and updated. We were upgraded from rooms to suites at no extra charge. Living room with couch, desk & TV/bedroom with chaise lounge & TV. HUGE bathroom with extra-deep tub & separate room for shower. Refrigerator, coffee maker & wet bar... Unheard of in some Chicago hotels. Great location in a lively area of Chicago. Just cross the street and you are on the river walk. Very close to the Mag Mile.

Reviews.Title: “Being cheap for the location does not undercut it's excellence”
Reviews.Author: Scott-from-Texas
Reviews.Content: In Chicago for business so basically booked one of the cheaper options in the downtown Chicago area. I was expecting somewhat less than glamorous accomodations but was pleasantly surprised to find this was a top notch joint. It is right on the river(across the street!) and just a few blocks from one of the train stations as well as Millenium Park. The entry, bar and lounge are somewhat sophisticated and the room itself was perfectly suitable. Good wifi, comfy bed, coffeemaker, largerish tv and very friendly/helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “It's not dingy but it's not luxurious.”
Reviews.Author: NickAgo
Reviews.Content: The bathrooms are old and outdated. The rooms are spacious if awkward. The view (we had a river view) is very nice. The gym is well equipped. The location is good. The lobby is modern and the staff is welcoming. No minibar/fridge, 2 glasses in the bathroom, but free Keurig coffee in the room. The free wireless internet is slow. Considering the options for hotels in Chicago, this may not be the best value depending on the time or other places available. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lbourinaris
Reviews.Content: I checked in an was given the executive suite! Beautiful on the 35th floor. Food in restaurant was good and room service good. They serve illy coffee!! Amazing staff

Reviews.Title: “VERY spacious room!”
Reviews.Author: petey2428
Reviews.Content: 4.5 I was pretty concerned about my stay after reading unfavorable reviews, but our stay was surprisingly very pleasant! We took advantage of the Groupon offer ($110 a night for a standard 2-queen bed room). The service was fast AND friendly. The location was amazing. The room was HUGEE (for comparison, it was about the same size or even slightly bigger than our 1 bedroom suite at the Intercontinental Chicago). The furnishing was relatively nice too, MUCH better than I anticipated (no ugly yellow checker-board pattern to my delight!) The only minus that prevents this from getting a 5 star is the horribly worn out bathroom. Our room was pleasant, but our bathroom was not. It's extremely old and worn out. Pro: VERY spacious room. You would not find a room this big ANYWHERE in Chicago for this price point. Con: Furnishing may not be up-to-par with other boutique hotels, but I personally think that the very spacious room easily makes up for that. It really comes down to decor VS. space. You could either choose another boutique hotel with amazing decor but small space or Hotel 71 with lots of space and a nice, but not amazing, decor.

Reviews.Title: “great stay at hotel 71”
Reviews.Author: RonZ
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our 3 day trip to Chicago and our stay at Hotel 71. The reviews here are pretty much right on - location was just fantastic for us -- right between Loop/Theater district and River North/Mag Mile. How could it be better? Can walk just about anywhere or simply grab a train or cab. Very friendly staff; huge, river view room was very comfortable. We ate a couple of times in the main floor restaurant / bar - quite a comfortable, attractive room with good food but wasn't very busy as I gather it is very new. Very good value for money - we could have stayed at Trump Tower directly across the river, at 3 times the price but why bother when you are there to see the city? We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: twick012
Reviews.Content: Wow - I stayed here for a few days in March and there is simply not a bad word to say. The hotel has been refurbished recently with a thoughtful eye for design, and the river view rooms at least have a chaise longue and work desk which added up to more living space than I even have at home! (The last phase of work is still happening so the fitness centre had apparently been moved to a temporary location, but I didn't need to use it anyway and none of the rooms are affected.) And what a view the river view is - I was on the 31st floor looking straight across the Chicago River to Marina City, the Wrigley Building etc. The location couldn't be better for downtown Chicago (it's just across the river from the Magnificent Mile shopping district but the city centre is more pedestrian friendly than one or two other US cities I've stayed in)and the helpful staff are an extra asset. There's a small restaurant on the ground floor but there are lots of other places to eat in the Loop district (although some of the more cafe-type places close surprisingly early...) Assuming rates stay the same this will definitely be the first place I look for a room if I visit Chicago again. There are some great deals online (I used Expedia) for bookings here meaning that I was able to get a large river view room here for less than you'd pay for a poky bedroom with shared bathroom in London!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again when in the city”
Reviews.Author: RichieRock
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on business from the UK. Didn't really know what to expect as my company booked the room - I'm glad they did. The room was on the 27th floor with a fantastic view right down the river. The room was big, well appointed and the wifi worked well. The staff were all friendly and polite. As stated in other reviews, the location is great and I could walk to my work venue and also walk to Michigan Ave. and the lakeside in the evenings. My only two minor issues were firstly, the room was near the lift shaft and there was a bit of noise from the lift at night. Secondly, I had breakfast twice - it was really good but painfully slow in coming. Maybe have a buffet for those who just want cereal and toast? They were minor gripes. Chicago is a great city and I would certainly stay here again if I'm ever able to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: b0cam0m
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in downtown Chicago, and this one is at the top of my list! The location off Michigan Avenue, on the Chicago River, near shopping and restaurants is ideal. The room was huge and my two teens and I were VERY comfortable. The outdoor cafe/restaurant was convenient and the food/service was wonderful. We visit Chicago every summer and I know we will book Hotel 71 for our next trip! The fact that the "Transformers 3" movie was being shot right outside the hotel was an added bonus to our annual Chicago trip!

Reviews.Title: “I will be back.”
Reviews.Author: IrelandBrian52
Reviews.Content: This is an absolute gem of a hotel. The location is as good as you'll get in Chicago and only matched by the quality of the staff who were interested without being over enthusiastic. Terrific room on the 33rd floor with 2 large beds, 2 big armcahirs and a desk and chair that wouldn't look out of place in a boardroom. Ou room had a river view which was stupendous! It is definitey worth paying a few extra dollars for the River View. Nice little bar and restuarant with very friendly staff. Loads of decent restuarants nearby within a 5 minutes walk. I cannot say enough about Hotel 71, it made our stay in Chicago. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kosampler
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel and have no complaints excellent hotel just recently refurbished with a new restaurant , in fact while we were staying their the restaurant was reviewed by a local food critic who complimented the standard of food

Reviews.Title: “I cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: lara098
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with the service at the front desk provided by Renuka and Suheyb! They recommended some great restaurants, one including "Quartino's" (Italian) within walking distance. The bellman who helped us with our bags was also very friendly. Our room with a view of the river was spectacular - clean, modern with two vanities in the bathroom! Rooming with two teenage girls was easy with this set up! There aren't many hotels with free WiFi - much appreciated amenity. We didn't eat at the new restaurant in the hotel, but will most likely try it next time, as it looked very inviting. We ate at The Bakery Cafe both mornings for breakfast and loved it - just a few steps away from the hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect for what we wanted to see/do. It is extremely close to Millennium Park and all the shopping on The Mile. We walked to Shedd Aquarium; although it was quite a jaunt, it was doable given the nice weather. An overall fantastic experience for us - loved Hotel 71!

Reviews.Title: “The best I've ever been in”
Reviews.Author: pr0f1
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago in January at fair trade. I've stayed in 71 Hotel and it was excellent choice. Room was spacious, bed comfortable and bathroom clean. Free internet has been only in one special internet room with few computers. I didn't noticed restaurant, but at the right nearest corner is bakery and at the left grocery. It was ma best ever hotel stay so I truly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “One block from Michigan Ave. Superb Service, with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: MI-SNOWNUT
Reviews.Content: Ever go to one of those hotels where everything goes wrong? Well, this isn't that place. Arrived 3/11/11. Was greeted outside with the cab door held open for my wife by the bellman. From there our suite was on the 25th floor with a river view. Excellent ! We headed out for dinner. The bellman told us about a great restaurant. Since Michigan Ave. is only one block away we had a lot of choices. Grand Lux was great too. When we got back to the hotel my wife gave the Bellman $5 for the recommendation. Saturday, we watched the river turn green while sipping coffee in our room. Room Service is lightning quick. Despite the restaurant only being open for ONE DAY. No kinks, We had Jose as our server, the place was packed, food came promptly and Jose was on top of his game with service. Normally I never eat in a hotel but the food smelled so good in the lobby it was the obvious choice. Both Friday and Saturday nights were peaceful, the wife and i both had great sleeps. One of the things I read here was the elevators were slow. I counted 17 sec from the door close in the lobby to the 25th floor. Not slow in my book. While the hotel is under a bit of renovation we never noticed it. I have been going to Chicago for over 25 years. This was the best room I have EVER had. We'll be back next year for sure. Highly recommend ! AAAA++++

Reviews.Title: “Real value”
Reviews.Author: hvaarala
Reviews.Content: Worth of every penny, great view on the river, quiet, near by metro station, walking distance from shopping districts, friendly staff, free wlan.

Reviews.Title: “Aweome attractive and affordable Downtown Chicago stay!”
Reviews.Author: gjscraftygirl
Reviews.Content: While in Chicago for a business trip in July 2010, rather than staying at the conference-offered hotels, we instead opted for Hotel 71. Having heard great things from family that had visited and after the hotel gave us a discounted group rate, we couldn't pass it by. The hotel is right on Wacker and just off of Michigan. Our room on the 33rd floor overlooked the Chicago River right over to the Trump Tower. We had a room for 3, and plenty of space for all of us. The rooms are large, comfortable and nicely decorated. The next time (July 2011) we return for our conference, everyone in our group plans to jump on the Hotel 71 deal again! Rather for business or pleasure, this hotel is sure to impress. The rates are so much better than local competition, and the customer service is fantastic. Not a single problem at all with our stay and even though we split the room 3 ways, they were eager and responsive to accomodate our requests. This is a winner! So beautfiul! Check out the website for wonderful photos! Can't wait until July 2011 to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Alley = Premium city view?”
Reviews.Author: F32boater55
Reviews.Content: We opted for the "premium city view" room which was slightly less expensive than the "river view" rooms. Our room faced the back of another building and all the fire escapes and the alley filled with dumpsters. This was totally unacceptable. The service was supreme as when we complained we were immediately moved to a much nicer river view room with spectacular views of the city and the river at Michigan and Wacker drive even during the Christmas shopping season. Excellent location, comfortable room, excellent service. The bar was EXTREMELY small. and the restaurant was a large room with three or four small tables scattered about. You would never know you were in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: LIK0S
Reviews.Content: First of all i must say that i picket this hotel during my stay in Chicago and i did not prebooked it.The negative reviews made me to avoid reservating a room but they were sooooooo wrong.It is the first time in my life that i get what i pay .The hotel is at the best area of the town.The river.The views from the room are AMAZING. From my window i could see the skyline and the river of Chicago in all its greatness.I felt like i was living in a cart postal.The room was huge for the Chicago standards and very clean.The decoration was classic with a very big marble bathroom.I can say that the room was equal to 5 star. The staff was very polite and helpfull.A special thanks to Suheyb at the front desk who helped me in a difficult situation that i had.We did not have breakfast in the hotel but every morning we ate in a bakery at the corner of the street which was excellent.The lobby is small but cosy.The possition of the hotel is very convenient as you can walk to all the major attractions or even the shopping area.Generally i think that is the best hotel that i could choose for Chicago except if i had $350 to spend for a standard room in Trump tower which is across it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: pso775
Reviews.Content: We arrive at Hotel 71 with absolutely no idea what we should expect. What do we find? One of the best customer service-driven hotel staffs I have ever seen. It started when I set up our reservation with the reservations department. She was absolutely amazing. When we arrived? Again, amazing. The young lady at the service desk bent over backwards to make our check-in painless and enjoyable. Ok, on to the hotel. I booked a lower-level city view room (they were on sale at the time). This was my wife and I's 20th anniversary and I was a bit nervous that we would get a less-than-adaquate room because of the price. What did we get? A room on the 27th floor with a view of the river. They had already upgraded our room, without our requesting, which is very cool. The views from the room are amazing. When we left for dinner, I was approached by two different employees asking if we needed assistance in hailing a cab. Since we were going to the House of Blues, which is only about two blocks away, there was no point in getting a cab but their attentiveness was amazing. When we returned to the hotel? The staff greated us and asked how our night went and then asked if we need anything. I have never, in my life, experienced better customer service from a hotel than I did this weekend. I know how people tend to write lengthy reviews on this site. I know that I get bored reading them after a certain point. I will finish by saying this.... You WILL NOT be disappointed if you stay here. From the customer service, which is AMAZING, to the location, which is also AMAZING, you will not be disappointed. And another cool fact? You are staying across the river from the Trump Towers. They cost $395 per night. I paid $89. I got the same views with probably the same level of customer service. How can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: “A short stay at a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVixen
Reviews.Content: My beau and I spent one night in just before Christmas at Hotel71. We had a beautiful room overlooking the river. Comfortable bed, amazing pillows, upscale amenities. The room was spacious, large bathroom with separate tub (jacuzzi jets would have made it perfect) and stand up shower, in-room coffee maker. The location was fabulous - steps from Michigan Ave, a few blocks from Milennium Park and $7 cab ride to the Hancock Bldg. We took advantage of their 25% off early booking so we got a great rate. Parking is pricey, but there are two self-park lots a very short distance away. The one right next door closes at 5pm but is half the rate of the hotel. We had a cocktail at the bar - pleasant bartender. The staff was very friendly. Overall it was just terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice.”
Reviews.Author: TonyJxx
Reviews.Content: I'll be frank, we loved our stay here, the guest service was fantastic, the location is nearly unbeatable. We appreciated what a great value it was and everything was spotless. What was wrong with this was they have top notch everything but the quality of the rooms, if not the bizarre room layouts, but the peeling wallpaper everything seemed dated and out of sync with the rest of our stay here. With a great revamp of the inside it will match the service of the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and View”
Reviews.Author: Sherrick62
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and super close to the L Train, Magnificent Mile, Riverboat Tours and within walking distance to Navy Pier, etc. Awesome service, very willing to help and answer questions. We had a room with the river view and it was gorgeous. Will definitely stay here again. Only negative thing we encountered was the elevators are quite slow, but it was nothing that was going to overshadow the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great rooms, but bad housekeeping service”
Reviews.Author: chelij
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our mini getaway to Chicago. We are EXTREMELY picky about the hotel we stay in (especially with the recent bedbug outbreaks). After much research we decided on this hotel. I was really impressed with the room. We booked a city view (cheaper than a river view, but we got a river view anyway). They gave us a beautiful room on the 27th floor which happened to be a corner room....2 walls FULL of windows. One wall gave us the "city view" which was of some beautiful architectural buildings (my bf is a photographer and went nuts taking pictures of the building elements from our windows) and the other wall gave us a view of the river and some more buildings. Really nice view! The room was clean and big enough (not huge, but you don't need a room any bigger for 2 people). The bathroom was also clean and attractive. This place is a GREAT location as well. All main attractions are a 30 minute walk, or a $5 cab ride. We arrived by train and it cost about $5 to get to our hotel by cab. We also cabbed it to the Aquarium & Natural History museum, and Navy Pier...both $5. We walked to Millennium Park and Hancock Tower (5 min and 30 min walks), and it is right at the south end of the Magnificent Mile. The staff at the front desk were EXTREMELY polite and cheerful at all times! The only complaints I have are the following: - The room was extremely cold. There is a thermostat that you can control your room temperature but I didn't figure it out until the next day. We left a $5 tip with a little note for the housekeeper asking for an extra blanket. When we came back, the money was GONE, but NO BLANKET! We called down to the front desk explaining the situation, and we had to call 2X (45 minutes apart), wait another 30 minutes, then go down to the front desk and ask for the blanket AGAIN. VERY frustrating. - Not only did the housekeeper take our money without providing that little extra step of giving us an extra blanket, but they left garbage (including our note that we had written our request on) all over the floor in the room foyer. The next day, there was a HUGE wet spot in our room foyer that I ended up stepping in and hand to change my socks. - last complaint about housekeeping...they took FOREVER to clean our rooms! Even with the sign on the door requesting service, we would come back around 4 pm, and the room still wouldn't be cleaned. SO frustrating because we'd have to leave again because we didn't want to be there when they were cleaning the room. Complaints aside, the place was kept pretty clean, the service was pretty great, the location is PRIME, and it was a really good deal for what we were given. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay if you're in Chicago to do the tourist thing.”
Reviews.Author: lilygren
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Hotel 71 twice, and will definitely stay there again next time I visit Chicago. The location is perfect for experiencing the beautiful tourist-oriented parts of the city. Walk outside in the morning, and hit the cafe next door for breakfast, and then walk over to the lakefront or the Art Institute. The rooms are spacious and modern, and the view is spectacular. Overall, it's clean and contemporary, but probably not ideal if you have small children looking for recreation within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: coloradojentravels
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, the staff is so friendly and welcoming. I would definitely stay there again if Im back in Chicago. Our room was huge and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: wmscrsc
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Chicago. Stayed one night at the Hotel 71. The Hotel is nice, but older. The room was big by Chicago standards and it felt lacking in in decor. The views out of our 37th floor windows were fantastic. Then there was the bed. I called it the Fred Flinstone bed. It was so hard and uncomfortable that I was unable to sleep all night. Additionally, in the morning my back hurt. I mean really hurt. I thought the location was great, but I doubt I would ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: fenmen
Reviews.Content: let's start with the ugly: the first room they gave me was dingy, dirty and had paint peeling in the bathtub (who paints a bathtub in any case?)! in contrast, the room they gave me after i complained was more than good: a beautiful, large cushy king size bed, new flat screen tv, marble bathroom with amazing shower. and all i had to do was say: "are you kidding? give me a better room." and they did. the front desk staff were more than accommodating. here's the scoop: apparently 10 floors (the lower ones) have been renovated and the rest apparently are being saved for a second shooting of 'the shining.' advice: only book if you can be assured of a renovated room. next the bad: parking; the hotel didn't inform me that two doors down from their $45/nt parking was a lot for $28...bad. advice: don't drive to chicago if you can avoid it; i couldn't.... and now for a very, very good is location, location, location. hotel 71 is on wacker just above michigan avenue at the intersection of south michigan and north - there is easy walking down to the art institute or up along the miracle mile. it couldn't be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, some oddities”
Reviews.Author: JeremyInFairfax
Reviews.Content: Nice business-class hotel. Small but pleasant lobby. Just a block or two from the El, a block from Michigan Ave, etc. Small but very fast elevators. Only about a dozen rooms on each floor, which is unusual. My room was right by the elevator, but didn't hear any noise. From the floor plan my room looked smaller than most, but it was large by city standards. Bathroom was large and had the usual amenities. Free wireless internet, although it felt pretty sluggish.

Reviews.Title: “Put simply...awesome!”
Reviews.Author: zdjn27
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, a big thanks to Hotel 71! I had a great experience this past weekend. From check-in to check-out, I never felt out of place or unwelcome. Ryan assisted us with our check-in. I had requested in the reservation (done directly off of their websiteâ€¦you can save 25% if you book 14 days or more in advance!) to be able to get into our room early, and it was honored. We arrived a little before 1PM. Ryan was helpful, courteous and attentive. He asked us what brought us to Chicago, if we had ever stayed with them before and if we needed a map of the area. We took a map (a â€œConcierge Preferredâ€� map) of downtown Chicago. It listed points of interest, other hotels, recommended dining establishments and more. We took the elevator up to our room on the sixteenth floor. I noticed a lot of complaints on TripAdvisor regarding the wait for the elevator, but we never had to wait more than thirty seconds. They had two banks of elevators, with two elevators per bank. One bank was for rooms on floors up through twenty-three, so Iâ€™m assuming the other bank was for the higher rooms. Our room was great. A beautiful view of the Chicago River, its bridges, Wacker Drive, Trump Tower, etc., was what we had when we looked out the window. It looked even better at night. We had a Premier River View room with two queen beds. The bathroom was a very good size. In one part, there were two separate wash basins with a vanity at each, and in the other part, a good-size soaking tub and a large, glass-door shower with a rainfall shower head and a built-in seat. The water pressure was a little on the light side, but I have no complaints. No bathrobes, but the towels were plentiful! I guess you get the bathrobes if you book a suite. The beds were very comfortable. There was a DVD player in the room as well as hi-speed wi-fi, and both were free of charge! Had no problem with the DVD player and no problem connecting to the internet. There was an LG HDTV which provided a great picture. Our section of the floor didnâ€™t have too many people on it. There was a group of girls across the hall that didnâ€™t know how to shut up, but they werenâ€™t there too often. So, the walls are a little thin, but it wasnâ€™t a big deal. The closet was a good size, and it had a safe. It wasnâ€™t located in the bathroom as some other reviewers have said, so Iâ€™m assuming they had a different type of room than we did. We didnâ€™t order room service or go to the hotelâ€™s diner, so I canâ€™t speak for thoseâ€¦the room service menu looked good, though, and the prices were fair. There was no pool in the hotel, so if that is a must for you and your travel companions, youâ€™ll want to look elsewhere. But, we werenâ€™t there to swim! I donâ€™t remember the name of the lady who processed our check-out, but she was just as pleasant as Ryan was. Thanks again, Hotel 71â€¦weâ€™ll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: BarbOntheGo
Reviews.Content: We travel to Chicago several times a year for fun weekends and have stayed in several different hotels. We loved Hotel 71 so much we'll never stay anywhere else! The location is perfect for just about everything and the rooms are generous in size (by Chicago standards) and beautifully decorated. With had a City Deluxe room on the 37th floor and the view was phenomenal. The Corner Bakery is about 1/2 block away - perfect for a quick, tasty breakfast. Public transportation is within blocks, and just about anywhere is in easy walking distance. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “The Greatest in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: GCHHawaii
Reviews.Content: What a place. Excellent location right in clean downtown and within short walking distance to the â€œMagnificent Mile.â€� The view from our 32nd Floor River View room was lovely, up and down the river with their recently redone colorful waterfront. Even with glorious sunsets, and the Trump Tower (the second highest building in North America) is right across. We had lucked out. Booked at a very low rate through an international Internet travel agency, which went belly-up, and we were cancelled. But an absolutely great customer service lady, Diane Pena, went all out to get us back in with a river view at the originally confirmed price. Professional and attentive door service. Truly appreciative of a gratuity. Very pleasant, cheerful and welcoming reception. Joelle, one of the best anywhere. Room and bathroom inviting, large, bright, and clean. Big comfortable bed. A fridge you have to ask for in advance. Butâ€¦they still use old, electricity-guzzling incandescent bulbs. No one else does that any more in our extensive travels. Hey, save electricity and money. Would we come back? Of course. Soon. Altogether, in Mid-September, the hotel added to a dream vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location"”
Reviews.Author: iowatraveler020
Reviews.Content: Great Chicago Location. View of the river was beautiful. The rooms were huge, especially compared to other Chicago hotels. The rooms were clean and the staff was friendly. Only negative is the wait for the 1 elevator..sometimes up to 10 minutes. As long as you plan ahead, it isn't too big of a problem. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: saber45
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel 71 for 5-nights (9-21-10 to 9-26-10). First, as many have stated, the location of the hotel is perfect. There are numerous bus stops within a 2 block radius going in various directions. Rail lines " the "L" are just blocks away. Now for those who don't use public transportation while touring a city, then just step outside the hotel doors and there are always taxis waiting out front. Also the "Hop on Hop off" tour bus stop, where you can also validate your ticket if you purchased it on line, is just around the corner from the hotel's main entrance. Second, the hotel staff was very cordial at all times of the day and night. My friend and I arrived at the hotel around 1PM, the hotel front desk staff was very helpful and checking in and out required little effort on my part. Even the maintenance staff was always saying hi to us. Third, our room (1517?), a Premier River View 2-queen bed was perfect for two guys. We had separate wash basins which was nice especially for a 5-night stay. The bed was comfortable, nice size TV, workstation for my travel lap-top and the view was fantastic. We could have stayed just about anywhere in Chicago during our trip so needless to say, we were very pleased to have chosen Hotel 71.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, accomodation and service!”
Reviews.Author: VFW123
Reviews.Content: I was concerned about staying in a boutique hotel with two children (ages 7 & 10) but the Hotel 71 turned out to be just what our family needed. It is close to Michigan Ave with all wonderful restaurants, activities and shopping within easy walking distance. The room was exceptional (oversized) and included 2 queen/full beds, a chaise lounge and writing desk. The bathroom had a seperate toilet/shower room with a T.V. My kids loved taking a bath while watching kid shows. The hotel coffee shop acccomodated our breakfast needs and the staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “The staff of Hotel 71 made my downtown stay like a 1st class vacation.”
Reviews.Author: roomservicechic
Reviews.Content: The staff of Hotel 71 knows what customer service is, they could write the book on it. They made my niece's 10th birthday the very best and therefore she will have a great memory of sharing time with me forever. The room was clean and very nice, the view outstanding. Every concern was addressed asap. The only problem was with the outdoor cafe on Sat. morning, so just don't eat there, plenty of places close by for breakfast. I will go again when the next one turns 10.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular river view in the heart of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: markmooney31
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in the centre of all the amenities that Chicago has on offer. Our first impression when we checked into our splendid hotel room on the 36th floor was "Heaven". We were in awe with the view of the Chicago River outside that snakes it's way passed Hotel 71. The hotel is located beside Michigan Avenue bridge and it faces the Trump Tower from across the river. It is also conveniently located beside an "EL" station (Chicago's elivated rail network). We stayed here for 5 days in mid september 2010 and I loved this hotel in the best city in the world. The hotel staff were very friendly and courteous to any of our requests and the room was very clean, spacious and elegant. The hotel is perfect for romantic couples and my girlfriend and I had the time of our lives here. We plan to go back to Chicago before christmas and yes I will be booking back into this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a solid hotel with some of the...”
Reviews.Author: furniguru
Reviews.Content: This is a solid hotel with some of the most beautiful views in the city. The rooms are large and clean. Bathrooms are a bit worn down, but clean. Park your car yourself next door and save yourself more than $30 a night on valet parking. Near everything.

Reviews.Title: “A real jewel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernBurt
Reviews.Content: Newly opened Hotel 71 is a real jewel in downtown Chicago. Located just west of Michigan Avenue facing the Chicago River,it's opposite the much more expensive Trump Hotel. Shopping is a short walk away on the Magnificent Mile or walking the other way, to Macy's. The rooms are more like suites than the typical Chicago hotel rooms. Hotel 71 is much like a large, full service boutique hotel. The staff are friendly and hospitable. Parking is by valet but your car will be under the building instead of halfway across town. Breakfast is served in the cozy dining room, either buffet or ala carte. Imagine, fresh squeezed orange juice. The fitness center is way up where you can enjoy a fabulous view of Chicago. Upper floors facing south have a nice view of the Loop but I suggest paying a few bucks more for the river view. We could see seven bridges spanning the Chicago River. A few minor inconveniences: ice machines are only on a few floors and there are no soda machines. I'm proud to attach my name to this review. Burt Katz

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in The CHI!â˜ºâ˜ºâ˜º Second stay for us!”
Reviews.Author: Valleybrookln
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel in Chicago. Excellent Service! Thank You Reservation for seeing to our "Special Request". Friendly-Professional-Courteous! Love, Love,Love the location...can walk anywhere. Beautiful upscale room decor. Clean, clean, clean....did I say CLEAN! Thank You for letting us check in early & check out late! Thank You! Our #1 choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marb76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in March last year and was very impressed. We had a small hickup on checkin but this acutally occured by the hotel trying to be nice to us. They had given us a complimentary upgrade to a suite but it had a king sized bed and we needed a twin, this was rectified immediately and the staff were very very helpful. The rooms very very tastefully decorated, there was a decent gym upstairs. Unfortunately though we never got to eat in the restaurant as it was being renovated at the time but we did have room service and again I couldn't fault any of it. The location could not have been better, the hotel is right at the top of Michigan Ave and all of the shopping and sights are within walking distance, also the hop on hop off tours etc have a pick up point right outside the hotel. I found Chicago lovely and the people the friendliest I've met in the US. Cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “I expected a bit more!”
Reviews.Author: PauloCesar_S
Reviews.Content: Ok, Hotel 71 is not bad. The location is spectacular, it could hardly be better. I have been for four days with my wife in September 2010, and at check in I was offered an upgrade room overlooking the river and stuff, all for $ 140 more. I thought it best not and got the standard room. Well the room needed a makeover, but it is quite large and the bed is good. It also has Wi Fi quick and free. The front desk is very friendly and attentive. Chicago is an expensive city, so the 71 can be a good option, but rather a search for other hotels in the same category before going ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: jess_bessAustralia
Reviews.Content: I couldn't recommend this hotel more highly. Walking distance to lots of great shops and attractions. We got upgraded to a suite, which was beautiful and clean, and the staff could not have been more helpful. Lots of restaurants nearby and the hotel also offers free internet in its business center, which impresses me. I am so sick of being ripped off by hotels for internet. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: GilFennerty
Reviews.Content: Really nice boutique hotel. Unbeatable location. Rooms are new, large and well-maintained. Bathrooms beautiful and spacious. Service was very good. My only complaint was the bed and pillows. Both were a little disappointing. Relatively rough sheets, and oddly firm pillows. And hallways were a little noisy, so sleeping was only OK. But overall, this is a great place to stay, and I'd come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel 71 - Good but far from great”
Reviews.Author: JIMMYDEFARGO
Reviews.Content: I booked a premier room. I found no minibar/resp. refridgerator in the room. I called the operator and was told that there where no fridges left and I would be put on a waiting list. Since I booked a `premier` room that according to the add should have everything you`d expect from a boutique hotel! i think this is absolutly not aceptable. How ever, after a couple of phone calls I was able to change the room to one who had a refridge inside. Negative: I had to pack everything again and unpack as well (not exacttly what you what after a 30h Amtrak ride). I n my oppinion premier rooms should have at least a refridge/minibar. Since the premier rooms are as well on the lower floors I can`t see anything premier about them... The room service food isn`t great as well. However, the staff incl. housekeeping are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay to "walk" Chicago !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GOLFING28803
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel 71 September 10-12 for a fun weekend in Chicago. What a treasure we found !!!!!! From check in to checkout the experience was top notch. Each trip back to Chicago will include staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyJer
Reviews.Content: Close to everything, big room, clean facility, very courteous and helpful staff: We'd stay there again. Italian restaurant next door, McDonald's and grocery/liquor store within a short walk--what else do you need? Parking is expensive: Leave the car and take the train or a cab to the hotel from the airport. Cabs are cheap enough in town anyway.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL, FANTASTIC CITY”
Reviews.Author: CouncilSevenHills
Reviews.Content: After a long and exasperating internet search I finally booked my vacation at the Hotel 71 and it was wonderful!!! I trust in TripAdvisor and did alot of searching. This hotel got semi-mixed reviews. I always weed out the bad and am glad I did. From the time of check in to check out it was great. The room is not the biggest that I have stayed in but it was very comfortable for it being a very old building. The bathroom is very spacious and the TV in the bathroom is a nice touch. The bed was very comfortable. The best thing is the free WiFi it helped me keep in touch. The front desk personnel was always friendly and helpful making sure to say hello whenever we came into the lobby. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is very close to everything. In Chicago, you don't have a car, the public transportation is always available and goes whereever you want to go. Do yourself a big favor and book your next stay at Hotel 71. The only thing to remember is if you are taking the "L" from the airport to the hotel is to make sure you go the right direction when you come out of the train station, we got confused and were walking the wrong way and got confused so we had to take a cab to put us back on the right course. The directions on the hotel website said 3 blocks but if you are new to the city, you don't know which way north is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler32780
Reviews.Content: EVERYONE on the staff was charming, gracious, and helpful!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The location was perfect because of being central to everything. It was just around the corner from Wacker & Michigan Ave. across from the Chicago River. There was a Corner Bakery a few steps away which was perfect for breakfast. The room was spacious and lovely. We had a great view of the Chicago skyline. We could see a portion of Lake Michigan. I look forward to staying there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel--location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer002
Reviews.Content: Great location--can walk to most attractions in downtown area. Very friendly staff. Deluxe room with 2 queen beds was large. Great view of river and downtown buildings. Bought the "Go Chicago" 3 day card which was a great value. Wish they had a personal safe and refrigerator. Beds and pillows a bit hard. Rooms are clean and very quiet at night. Walls are thin but guests are quiet :) Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location-perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: GaleyGirl
Reviews.Content: We had wanted to stay at the Hotel Monaco but could only get 2 of the 3 rooms we needed so switched to Hotel 71, which is right across the street. What a great find-the rooms are large, the bathrooms comfortable with a flat screen TV included, the staff is friendly and efficient and the location, location,location!! Right on the Riverwalk, easy access to the subway, the Magnificent Mile, the lake, restaurants, etc. Can't say enough about this reasonably priced, great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not for business stay”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2visit
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week attending a convention. They advertise wifi or internet connection and they do not supply it. Your room does not have a wifi connection or the router does not work. So you have to leave your room and go to a public business center in the hotel. No privacy at using internet. Forget about working while you are in Chicago. Leave your lap top at home because the whole city is backwards when it comes to the internet. I lost money because I was suppose to work from my motel room during and after the convention. The parking cost $43-$65 dollars a night so make sure you add that amount to your hotel bill when budgeting. And they do not tell you there is no internet until you have moved all your stuff in. Room was nice and clean staff was nice. They made several apologies about internet but they have no clue as to how rooms without internet ruin a stay. Next trip to Chicago will probably be at a hotel 6 with free wifi. Of course I do not plan to return and warn everyone not to stay at the downtown luxury hotels unless you brought some entertainment with you.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: crazyjknee
Reviews.Content: Were hoping for the best since this isn't a 'brand' name but SOOO HAPPY we tried this boutique hotel. STAFF was GREAT as well as EVERYTHING ABOUT THIS PLACE! LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! Celebrating friends 50th the LADIES had a fab time all around and such a GREAT view of the City! As one other reviewer stated - it would be nice to have a mini fridge but all in all THUMBS UP UP UP!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed at Hotel 71”
Reviews.Author: kari19
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend Hotel71. It was clean, rooms were spacious & nice. Staff was friendly, our room was cleaned daily no matter what time we left. Didn't have to wait terribly long for elevators because there are 2 for bottom floors & 2 for upper floors. The hotel is very centrally located. Only thing I would have liked is to have a fridge and personal safe in room. Also very happy with purchasing in advance through skoosh, got the room we were promised at a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great views.”
Reviews.Author: Pashmina_Julia
Reviews.Content: As part of my trip to the USA, I stayed in the Hotel 71 for four nights in June. This was a business trip and I was very happy with the accommodation. I was expecting a large box to arrive for me from the UK and the reception staff were very helpful when it arrived and made sure it got to my room safely. My room was very comfortable and there was plenty of space including all the usual amenities - toiletries, bath robes, tea/coffee etc. Breakfast was served in the cafe adjoining the hotel and this was all fine - some quite large portions though! Location of the hotel is fab and just off Michigan Avenue - too handy for the shops! I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: HMSnyder
Reviews.Content: My 3 childhood friends and I enjoyed Hotel 71. Typically I stay on Michigan Avenue, but thought we'd change it up a bit and after reading several reviews, decided on Hotel 71. Great location...we had a river view....corner room with a panaramic view. To our surprise, right below our window they were filming Transformers 3. It was great to watch the transformation of E Wacker from Friday afternoon to Sat morning. Positive: Location, location, location. Also, the staff was accomodating/efficient, the rooms were clean and updated, the bathroom was decent size, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants, Navy Pier, Theater district. Negatives: THIN walls/ceilings, no real drop off for valet so when you do unload your car you are literally on the busy street, "for your convenience there is ice located on floor 12 and 36"....that isnt convenient in my opinion, no fridge or minibar in room.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again. liked location. convenient to good restaurants and transportation.”
Reviews.Author: jtmac9184
Reviews.Content: walking distance to popular shopping on state street. would not pay extra for the lake view; we were on 35th floor with city view and could see the lake. the hotel is few blocks from the water. excellent fine dining restaurants only a few blocks away. mccormick & schmick's within sight from from entrance and my favorite 'catch 35' a few doors past there. bus stops from cta, 'hop on-hop off' double decker buses, trolleys directly across street. so easy! taxis always available in front of hotel. doorman or front desk clerks take care of everything. ask desk clerks for directions or assistance of any kind. have great maps and other sightseeing information for guest. nice outside cafe just outside front entrance, or inside if prefer. we loved the outside for breakfast, late evening snack (fresh made kettle chips) and drinks. everything we tried was very good. fruit plate for breakfast was wonderful but easily enough for 2. prices reasonable for quality of food. just on corner from hotel is bakery which was also fabulous! 'corner bakery' i believe. large selection of fresh made breads and pastries. i had panini which i loved. others had reubens which they loved. also nice outside/inside dining. beautiful landscaping throughout the city made the outside cafes so enjoyable. whne very hot though we choose inside finer dining. catch 35 excellent! riva at navy pier also excellent--have outside bar and grill, inside cafe and upstairs finer dining. ate there twice while at the pier. very good!!! fresh oysters,crab cake sandwich, seafood salad, clam chowder, i personally know were wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service!”
Reviews.Author: colorisnteverything
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here to go shopping and hit Rush St. for nightlife. I am from Indiana, but just across the border and know the area, but didn't want to have to worry about going home after a night out. We booked on Hotwire for a great price. The minute you walk in, you are pleased by the pleasant (and soothing) sort of lobby. The front desk staff is EXCELLENT and took care of us. We even got to move in early and were upgraded from one bed to two and from a city view to a high river view. The room was HUGE. It had an office, a very nice bathroom and two large beds. Closet space was ample. It came with two comfy chairs and a HUGE window. The view of the Wrigley building and the river was great. I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel for under $200.00 in Chicago with such a view. We had no coffee in the room and wanted some before we left, so we called housekeeping. They brought us some with no fuss. Very pleasant staff. We went out to shop and it was a great location and the main reason for booking. The checkout in the AM was easy. And since we had to wait to catch the train, we left our luggage with the bellman. Brilliant staff, really great. Altogether, it was very nice. The shower was amazing in the morning and the linens were clean and bright. I would definitely stay here again. The service and location alone should sell you!

Reviews.Title: “The view is worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: brightmorningstar
Reviews.Content: Living in St. Louis we make weekend trips to Chi-Town a few times a year. This time I had one big request, a room with a view of the skyline...if I could get river+skyline for under $200 then I was pulling the trigger! In steps Hotel 71. It's a boutique so a little stripped down (as in not ice on every floor and room service people running around) HOWEVER the rooms are fine for Chicago. Staff was super friendly & knowledgeable. Beds comfy. Bathroom big and nice. Oversized King room was big. GREAT LOCATION. But the bread and butter of this hotel really is the VIEW. OMG magnificent. I watched the sun go down, the city come alive at night and just had to watch the sunrise. Get a river view/city view combo and when you check in tell them to put you up high (which they said is automatic). I paid base $179 for one night (Saturday in July). I still think of it and took about 300 pictures from the room. Oh, and the windows open...how cool for Chicago! Plus the river walk is RIGHT THERE. Very happy customer!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the location”
Reviews.Author: jimsellshomes
Reviews.Content: For our stay we chose a corner room and had a spectacular view of the Chicago River, Trump Tower, Wrigley Building and Marina City. Any of the Riverview rooms would pretty much have the same view but the corner room gave us a view to the south down Wabash Ave. We usually don't spend much time in our room but waking up in the morning with the great view and then coming back late in the day to people watch was a nice way to wind down. The location is great for those looking to explore the main Chicago attractions. Walking distance to pretty much everything or easy access via public transportation. If you need to take the "L" it's just a short walk to the State and Lake or Randolph and Wabash stations. Located just across Wacker Dr from the hotel you can take the riverwalk all the way to the lakefront without a street crossing. This hotel doesn't have a pool so if that's important stay elsewhere. The hotel does not offer a complimentary breakfast but a menu is available. We chose to pick up breakfast to go from the Corner Bakery Cafe located just a few steps from the front door to the hotel. The room was very comfortable and bathroom had a rain shower which was an interesting treat. There is a ballroom on the top floor with a great view of the city that you should check out if there are no meetings going on.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: lilAnthony
Reviews.Content: now i read all the good, bad & ugly about this hotel here on tripadvisor and decided to "take a chance" . i really cant believe anyone would write something bad about this place. ok, so they don't have a pool get a grip, go somewhere else if you really want a pool. when i checked in there was a problem with the reservation, because of 1800 hotel NOT because of the hotel, and they were very nice about the whole thing and right off the bat the lady at the front desk said not to worry they had rooms available. John Castronovo the business sales manager came out explained the whole situation and took my booking upgraded my room and the room rate was even LESS then what i had booked at. John apologized for the mistake made by 1800 hotels and was very helpful through out my stay. Being the dummy i am i read here that there were no "black out" curtains in the room, so as soon as i got in the room i looked, nope couldn't find them either, and i had a view room on the river so that meant when it was time for bed the room was still bright as day from the lights outside. the next morning i spoke to John and he was shocked at the story i told him. john said he would send a crew up right away to check because of course there are "black out" shades in the room. so i went back up to the room to check again for myself, and OF COURSE they were there. housekeeping had just pushed them back farther then i had looked. i had room 1014 a premium view room with two queens. was a fantastic room, the bathroom with two separate vanities a huge tub, walking in shower with built in seat. the wifi in the room was great, very fast. i was able to buy movie tickets on line and make dinner reservation too. there are 4 elevators, NOT two as someone here has stated. more correctly TWO BANKS of elevators. i never waited more then a few seconds for one. the gym on floor 37 (or 36) is very nice all new equipment and has a great view too. not sure why some people have complained about the property but in my opinion, its a very nice place to stay and i'll be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Neighbors and Got a Smoking Room - ugh”
Reviews.Author: sanfrandlle
Reviews.Content: I'll caveat my review with the fact that they were filming Transformers 3 right outside the hotel door when I arrived which I think impacted my experience. I was lucky to get a room at all - the movie staff were all staying there. Because of the overcrowding I was stuck with a smoking room which I absolutely hate! Everything seemed really dirty to me. Even the floor seemed sticky! To top it all off, I had party neighbors who played gangster rap into the wee hours of the morning. I will say that the hotel staff was very courteous about it and spoke to them and had them turn the music off. On another positive note, the room was ENORMOUS and the views amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Location best asset”
Reviews.Author: fillmap
Reviews.Content: Pros: located centrally to Mag Mile, Navy Pier, Millineum Park, Loop; boutique type hotel with large rooms well furnished. Cons: for those with children did not have a pool or breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay here again, BUT...”
Reviews.Author: RealisticMike
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Premier River View King for three nights, Wed-Sat July 7-10th 2010. We saved 15% on our stay and also got a $25 food/beverage credit. I typically stay in very nice hotels, (I.E., The Wynn, Westin in Maui) etc, and willing to pay big bucks for a nice hotel. I will offer some advice to the hotel as you will see, which is why I like to be realistic about my opinions. This hotel is slightly high in price, then again, its in Chicago so they can get away with it. You will read a lot about location. I have never been to Chicago before, and quite frankly, yes this hotel is by far the best in location. Upon arrival you will not find a door man or a bell hop. You will find a cart outside for your luggage which is nice, maybe the bell hop was busy or something but I never saw them helping anyone with their luggage. - Don't claim to be an elite hotel if your service isn't going to match what you claim you are. There was a man who stood in the lobby and near the door, but not once did they get the door for me, my wife or any other guest. If you are doorman, then been a doorman, not a Wal Mart greeter. Check in went very smooth, except they "try" to be overly friendly. I appreciate their effort, but its fake, soft voices, please and thanks after everything - it was just annoying. Instead, be genuine and polite...don't try so hard, it actually destroyed what you want to accomplish. Room was very clean and updated. Despite what you will read on here about the tubs, our tub was brand new. The bathrooms are wonderful. Its an older building so the A/C isn't the best, especially in the bathrooms. The hallways were muggy and hot. There is an electronic safe, microwave, refrigerator and even a wine/bottle refrigerator, coffee maker and coffee selections. No cream or sugar though, you'll need to call room service for that. There is a flat screen & a stereo that plays CD's. You can't listen to the radio because it doesn't have an antenna, and I don't know who brings CD's with them anymore, so its pretty useless, it doesn't even have an IPOD hook up. The windows will open slightly, which is nice to bring in the fresh air and street noises. Rooms have free Wi-Fi, and the closet space is very nice. A nice halogen recessed light turns on when you open these french doors. Overall, the room was very eligant and very up to date. The beds...oh boy. This gets the lowest mark possible. They cheaped out on the linens big time. The bed is comfortable, but the sheets are nothing special. They're not crisp. Pillows are nothing more then soft cardboard with a cover. Westin by far hands down has the best linens and pillows. For the price I paid, I expected a little more then motel sheets & pillows. We ordered up breakfast one morning, and it was fabulous! Wow. Very good, very high class and fancy, well worth every dollar spent, and the best part is I was full for most of the day after the breakfast. I'm always reading comments about how everyone loves the "rain" type shower heads. Personally, I hate them. I don't need a pressure washer for a shower, but something with a little more juice behind it then a trickle effect would be nice. For the size of the shower, they could have installed multiple heads. His/Her sinks is very nice, and they are on opposite walls which even makes it better. Only down fall is that the door opens up in front of one of the sinks, so you have to enter the bathroom first then close the door. Its already hot and steamy in there and closing the door doesn't help it. The heating/cooling doesn't seem to work very well in the bathrooms, probably because its an older building per se. A pocket door would have been ideal. Speaking of doors, the door into your room, yes it looks nice, but doesn't provide any protection from noises in the hallway. I could hear conversations inside other rooms simply by standing in the hallway. There were some people talking when they returned at 4am which I awoke too, so an insulated door would have been the way to go. The down falls is there is no pool. The hotel bar sucks. You feel like you're at a wedding reception/cash bar. There is no hospitality room, oh, and get this, the conceirge or front desk have very little recomendations or knowledge of Chicago. They will only know the resturants that are around the corner. I expected more expertise and knowledge. They knew very little about things like the double decker trolly tour, etc. It wasn't just one person that I asked either...try 4....and none of them knew much about anything. Big turn off here. Again, don't claim to be elegant if your not going to back it up with your staff. Employee training and knowledge should be as important if not more important then the cleaniness of your carpet and housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Room with an exceptional view”
Reviews.Author: RonnieSprigs
Reviews.Content: Great Location, which accounts for the great views. Stayed in room 3216, non-smoking twin on the 32 floor, right opposite the Trump tower. All staff very friendly, chamber-maid especially, room spotless and spacious by city standards. Stayed six nights. The hotel is a 3.5 star, but with a little modernisation could be 4.5 star. Huge twin beds with 4 pillows each, great air-con. The only very minor problem was the wedding party on the Friday night, who seemed to forget which room they were in, too much champagne!!

Reviews.Title: “Not if you like to sleep”
Reviews.Author: mirasmor
Reviews.Content: For some reason, housekeeping started the mornings around 07:30 with parading up and down the hallway shouting "Housekeeping!" And at 8:15 am they came in the room to make sure we heard them and asked again if we wanted them to start cleaning the room. This also happened in the afternoon, around nap time. No curtains to keep the light out. Another thing was that they put us (honeymooners) in a room surrounded by large families with small children.
