However room was spacious and clean with a good location, with wi-fi included.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe King Room = Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SumhrS
Reviews.Content: Room is subpar for the downtown Chicago experience. Every summer, my boyfriend and I stay in downtown Chicago for the Taste of Chicago/4th of July festvities. We normally find deals on TravelZoo and book accordinly. This year, Hotel 71 had the best deal + a parking credit so we chose this one. We were able to check in early (which was nice), hotel check-in staff was friendly. At first glance, the room was nice. Then we went into the bathroom and both of us felt like we were in a college dorm community bathroom. There were random holes in the wall, there were multiple strange knobs behind the toilet that weren't secure, not sure what those were for? The bathroom door was a pain to open and close, didn't fit the frame well. The ceiling over the shower was cracked and looked really bad. Towels were old and rough. We called down to the Front Desk and were told the hotel was "almost full" so they couldn't do anything for us tonight. They also said that ALL Deluxe rooms had the same bathroom so we were told to check back for a new room tomorrow. We have stayed at the Hyatt, The Swissotel, Hotel Sax, and The Blackstone to name a few. The Hotel 71 Deluxe King room bathroom in comparison is like a Motel 6 bathroom!! Needless to say, we will never stay here again, I wouldn't even try a Premier room to see if it's better, just not interested.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great rooms, great service!”
Reviews.Author: trekbetty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for the Neocon conference. The location is excellent for business or pleasure and at a price much less than other hotels nearby. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great views of the chicago river”
Reviews.Author: airdale2010
Reviews.Content: Corner rooms on river side have great views. Hotel is well maintained and has a nice outdoor cafe bar. Convenient valet parking. Attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “BOTP - Lads holiday & Cubs game”
Reviews.Author: MarkMelManchester
Reviews.Content: Great place - Great service staff upgraded us on arrival. Close to shopping and bar districts. Free business centre to complete your pre departure check-in. Didnt eat or drink at hotel. 3 mins walk to Millenium Park for cold beers and free bands playing - Awesome. Make sure you take the 'Chicago Segway tour' (the best of the Segway companies) of the lake and take in a Cubs game

Reviews.Title: “No problems...great time”
Reviews.Author: love_those_wings
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded upon arrival from our king/river room to a king on the 36th floor with a conference room attached! It was a little odd to have another room with a HUGE table in it, but the views were great. We had three windows facing in different directions...the river, towards the lake, and one toward the art museum and water beyond. The bed was comfortable, plenty of pillows. The bathroom was nice, the bath products smelled like sherbert! Our daughter didn't have any problems with the internet. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “$275 for nothing.”
Reviews.Author: Unhappytraveler2010
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a glowing review about the fabulous time that I had at Chicago's Hotel 71. For $275, I bet it would have been something to remember. However the sad truth is that I have no idea what kind of hotel it is because I have never stepped foot in the building. I can say however their their customer service is for crap. They stuck me with an unreasonable charge of $275 for a "no-show" penalty for an online reservation that I don't remember making. They never sent any kind of email previous to the date to remind me about my upcoming stay. I don't recall the reservation existing and therefore I couldn't possibly remember to call and cancel. The hotel was completely unsympathetic about charging me $275... for nothing. My advise to travelers...find a hotel with better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique on a grand scale”
Reviews.Author: The_Sherriff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 71 as part of a conference deal. It is slightly odd in that it is quite a big hotel but functionally stripped down in the manner of a boutique - which has significant impact on the value for money. There are no bars, restaurants, function rooms, concierges, etc - just a small pavement cafe and rather basic business centre and fitness room. Essentially, all you are paying for is the room - and ours was a stunner on a high floor with a view inland down the Chicago River. It was beautifully kept by a charming Mexican maid and a real pleasure to spend time in. The only downside was a bit of lift noise - the sound insulation was good but this is very hard to eliminate completely. The Sherriff was just a bit cross that he hadn't noticed the location at check-in because the room door seemed to be such a long walk from the lift shaft - it was but the room was quite long! The staff were very friendly although we ate at the nearby Corner Bakery, which was not only cheaper than the hotel cafe but also had really drinkable tea (as far as any tea is drinkable in a paper cup...).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but it Needs a Reno”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: My experience matches several of the recent reviews here. The world's oncology conference (ASCO) was in Chicago again this year and I stayed 3 nights. The location is terrific: close to great restaurants, shopping and the lakeshore. The front desk staff is very friendly and attentive. There are only 2 elevators to the upper flows and they are very slow. The Corner Bakery next door has good food at good prices and very good coffee for breakfast; avoid the tiny restaurant in the hotel lobby as the service is slow and there is limited selection. The rooms are dated, however, and my bathtub would not drain: I hated my shower, as I would be standing in 4 inches of water. The drapes are shear, so you are awakened at 5:15 AM with the bright sunlight at this time of year. Yes, the soundproofing is poor so you constantly hear the maids and room service guys in the hallways. All in all, Hotel 71 is just OK. I am surprised it is rated in the top 40 hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dps14
Reviews.Content: Great View, Great Location, No Frills. My first trip to Chicago and had a wonderful time. The hotel was clean and to the point- great room with awesome location- walking distance to anything worth seeing. Prices were reasonable and staff was very friendly. I recommend renting some bicycles and riding through the city, the aquarium was average, definitely eat some pizza, and don't miss Hot Doug's (best hotdogs ever), just a short walk from great shopping

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, but great location (with river view) and reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: raylee11
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel is ok. Best thing is the price and location. Depends on what you're looking for I guess. Lobby very nice, and front desk staff always very friendly. Always acknowledged you when you came in. Kinda creepy in a way, but nice. They were helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. Had a "deluxe" room which is probably standard. Room was huge! Nice bonus, but it was a little dated and in need of a reno, wrt to furniture and older TV which did not have the best picture. Beds were decent. WiFi very spotty and slow. Had the a/c cranked and it was only cool, but it was mid-90's outside. Bathroom most dated though. Liveable, but tub was chipped and faded, found hair in it, and in toilet too. In hindsight, should've paid the extra $40/night for premier room which look renovated on the website. Hallways dim as well with worn walls and old carpet. Also noisy at times. Got the AAA rate ($200/night) for a river view, but check you're bill. We had to correct it. Other hotels offering same view were at least $75/night more. There were fireworks one night because they were filming a Ron Howard/Vince Vaughn movie. Wrt location...it was easy to get to from MDW via the Orange line and a short walk. Corner Bakery literally next door for breakfast, which is important because there is only a litle cafe in the lobby. You're right at the base of Magnificent Mile so go north for shopping, Hancock, Navy Pier, etc. If you go south on Michigan Ave, the Art Institute is only about 10 min away, while the Shedd and Field Museum is about 30 min away on foot. Btw, the dock for the Architectural Cruise by the CAF is there too. Warning...get tickets early because almost all times were sold out. You can go on Ticketmaster but there is a service fee. Again, hotel is at the centre.....location, location, location. Hope that helps. Still can't say "go Hawks" though without cringing...but I know that 3/4 of the team are Canadian. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with-out the frills”
Reviews.Author: DJinSC001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel 71 for the National Restaurant Association Food Show in May 2010. The hotel was a bit over priced but I am sure it was because of the convention. The staff was very nice and the rooms are OK. The bathrooms could use some updating and the TV was from the late 90â€™s but worked ok. Hallways are noisy when people are in them or doors are closing. Wireless internet was terrible; it was complimentary, which is great but the signal was very week and kept going in and out. Donâ€™t stay at this hotel if you need a consistent signal. The restaurant was very small, only three tables and was in the same room as the coffee counter and at night they converted it into a make shift bar. They had some seating outside but you had to go through the front door and the service outside was very slow. When you check-in they try to up-charge you for the â€œriverâ€� view but I am not really sure if it is worth the extra expense since they were already charging a premium for their rooms. The city view is nice as long as you are above the 25 floor. All in all and ok hotel, not great but not bad for an independent hotel in a city; I am partial to the standards of a â€œbrand nameâ€� hotel and knowing what I am getting. The rooms are very large. The location is good for the business but I will probably stay closer to Water Tower next time to be by all the good nightlife and restaurants. Good luck and enjoy Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Some of the Dark Knight was Filmed at this hotel! - oh and Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: YoungAdult
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for my trip. The hotel is not on Michigan Avenue, but it located in an excellent location. It kinda sits in-between the Chicago board of trade building / Sears building and the John Handcock Building (which is on Michigan Avenue). It is also located a short walk to navy pier and millennium park. Just google maps it and you will know where it is. The service was great, we even got a bigger room just by asking! The front desk was always helpful. The one guy at the front desk was even going to take us up to the penthouse to show us around (this is where part of the Dark Knight was filmed for you film enthusiastic`s). However, there was always a function going on up there, but if there is not - check it out. The hotel doesn`t have a big bar and the happening bars are a bit of a walk (5-10min)...but I enjoyed walking so it didn`t bother myself or my family. Just a good hotel overall - for tourists at least.

Reviews.Title: “great location - hotel fine”
Reviews.Author: Sota4
Reviews.Content: We celebrated at 40th birthday trip. Three women - we choose this hotel due to good reviews, price, and location. The location was fantastic. We walked everywhere! We were on the 36th floor deluxe city view with 2 queens. You could see the lake and Science Museum far out in the distance from our window. The hotel was fine. Not a lot in ammenities but it was only our base so it worked well for us. Nothing fancy but fine. Rooms and bathroom roomy. Service was very helpful and polite. For the price and location I would stay here again. It is close to Corner Bakery for breakfast and also a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/rough sleep”
Reviews.Author: L8kSt8Matt
Reviews.Content: For the price and the location, this is one of the best hotels in Chicago. The extras were outstanding. Service was great, the gym was well-equiped and had a GREAT view of the river and the city, and the location is right off of Michigan Avenue. The only complaint I had was the room was right next to the service elevator, which led to a rough nights sleep because we constantly heard the squeaking of the line. The food also wasn't great, especially breakfast. That is easily remedied with the Corner Bakery just down the block. Well-recommended for anyone there to do business, visiting the loop, or to enjoy the theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, but great location and GREAT staff!!”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: Expected much more. The river view room was amazing in regards to the view. It was beautiful. the rooms are big however, old decor which could needs to be updated. Its clean however. The windows feel awkward because they make the room look small (!) if you know what i mean, The location is GREAT!! Walking distance to Michigan Avenue. The staff is WONDERFUL. Nice, caring, polite.Really good people. It can been noisy in the morning and i guess the walls are thin. you can hear the cleaners etc. Otherwise no noise from the traffic or so. with train from O'hare it takes about 35-40 minutes.Really easy to catch and it cost about $2,70 or so for a one way ticket. Also free internet!! The food was ok at the hotel but since the bar staff are nice its pleasent to sit there....

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms / Incredible Beds / STELLAR STAFF !! A++++”
Reviews.Author: MovieDoug
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Very attentive and accommodating. We got a corner room with an incredible view through a double paned triangular window. So beautiful at night !!! The location is great, although if you are coming to Chicago for the nightlife, this is not the area. I would also recommend not getting a rental car for Chicago. The subway system is pretty good, and taxis are everywhere. Valet parking charges are very high all over Chicago, actually much higher than what is charged in Los Angeles. The parking rates are Hotel 71 are $43 a night which is actually cheaper than some of the competitors in the area. There are local overnight parking garages for $30 if you want to save your pennies. Overall, the Hotel 71 was romantic, tasteful, and a wonderful experience. Definitely recommend !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday trip!!”
Reviews.Author: BNWoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a weekend at Hotel 71 for his birthday. We have been to Chicago many times and try to stay in different hotels each time. Hotel 71 was great!! The staff were VERY friendly and helpful. The room was fairly large and clean with a huge bathroom. The location is perfect for anything you would want to do...very close to both Michigan Ave and State St. for shopping, very close to many fabulous restaurants and bars/pubs, and very close to the theatre and museum districts. Also, the price was amazing! We will definately be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Hkdc
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a room with a view of the river. There's a Corner Bakery next to it, a 7-Eleven around the corner. The room was five star quality. Modern and spacious. I ordered room service once and did not wait long. The front desk staff were always helpful. One thing I did not like is the heater was off for the whole building. The had to give me a space heater. Overall, a great hotel and would stay here whenever I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Friendly, Gracious & Helpful Staff. Spacious Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoVacationer_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 25-28, 2010. Great experience. We were greeted with genuine, sincere, friendly smiles by the front desk personnel upon arrival. And also each time we left the hotel; and each time we returned. They were friendly and helpful during the quick check-in process, and also with questions we had throughout our stay about sites & restaurants in Chicago. The rooms were spacious, very clean and quite comfortable. The cleaning staff did a superb job each morning. Elevators were fast and efficient. Thermostat in room worked perfectly. Free internet service and a desk in room. And, as mentioned in other reviews, convenient walk to both the Loop & The Magnificient Mile. Be sure to eat at the restaurant across the street, "The Emerald Loop". It was also wonderful. Tenderloin Sliders were FAB ! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: pburris
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. You literally could not ask for a hotel that is more in the middle of Chicago. The hotel is situated right on the Chicago River with views of the Trump Towers and Chicago Tribune. Our room was great as well. We were offered a huge board room type suite for no additional charge. The room was massive and EXTREMELY clean.

Reviews.Title: “They are trying, but not there yet”
Reviews.Author: SteveG60
Reviews.Content: Positives - Location, room/bed Negatives - Hot Water, water pressure, internet svc, restaurant From what I understand, they have been under renovation for over 2 years, and it shows. The room itself is nice. Well sized and laid out, comfortable king size bed, flat screen TV, DVD player, stunning river view, great location. Now the negatives. The remodeled bathroom has a rain style shower which merely dribbles. Water pressure was so bad I was afraid I would never get the shampoo out of my hair. Shower took twice as long as it should have. Hot water in the vanity sinks (the dual sinks is a nice touch) took over 5 minutes to come up. All I could think is that there is no recirculating pump, or it is on a floor being renovated and not functioning. Internet service is horrendous. It drops on and off, and I had to keep changing servers, as each one I had last connected to simply disappears. The main restauarant is still closed after 2 years. There is a small cafe with a limited menu. Pricing is interesting, as the dinners are reasonable ($9 burger, $16 grilled salmon), the breakfasts are outrageous, $13 for an a la carte omlette. Go around the corner for something more reasonable. I will say the grilled salmon was quite good. With the great location and well appointed rooms, hopefully the rest will come together if they ever finish renovating!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience great location”
Reviews.Author: Eyal01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Chicago to meet some friends. We were looking for a great location hotel with good price. And we found it. Hotel 71 on Wacker Dr. The hotel was great and we enjoyed the service, the expeirence and of course the location which is close to few "L" train stations. It of course took us some time to find an Hotel with the price we wanted but we finally found it in easyclicktravel.com Botton line... Recommended,

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: CandCPhilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a Friday business trip that I extended into a long weekend. This hotel was very good for both business and leisure travel. It's location on the Chicago River just off Michigan Avenue places it at the heart of the city's business area. At the same time, the hotel is within walking distance of the restaurants in River North, shopping on the Magnificent Mile, concerts and other events in Millennium Park and the treasures of the Art Institute. Rooms are well appointed, clean and comfortable for either the business or leisure traveler. The business center has several free access internet terminals for the use of guests. Unfortunately, the hotel lacks a restaurant or breakfast area. Nearby are the Corner Bakery and other popular breakfast spots, but that does require going out in the weather to get there - not always a great thing in Chicago. This is the only drawback that leads me to give the hotel a four star rather than a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: LisaT18
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for the weekend for a touristy Chicago weekend (we live in the Chicagoland). It was exactly what we needed, great location and a great price. The room was nice and big, no real complaints. If your looking to impress someone, this would not be the place, but it was still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: Grgegirl9
Reviews.Content: We ended up at Hotel 71 after a Hotels .com search for downtown Chicago hotels close to the magnificent mile. The price was right and were were surprised with an unexpected upgrade to an Executive Deluxe. The newly renovated room was lovely, the view spectacular, and the ease of walking around to where we wanted to go was exactly what we were hoping for and more. Michael and Kareem were wonderfully welcoming and the only thing I would change is to forego the valet parking and just park the car for the weekend. We never drove anywhere! Walked the mile and then over a few blocks to Fado's Irish Pub.. authentically fun atmosphere, cold beer and excellent appetizers while we watched the football games. That night we walked- literally- one block over the bridge to eat dinner at Smith and Wollensky . We had a river view window table, excellent service and the best Steak Oscar I have ever tasted. We'll definitely be back to Hotel 71

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service...”
Reviews.Author: katelynsandon
Reviews.Content: I feel like I need to write a review where I have stayed in the past year, due to the fact that I have been utilizing trip advisor for all of my hotel stays. (great product!) However, this hotel was extremely disappointing. The room was very nice and the location was great. However, I stayed here for Valentines day and the service was a disappointment. When we pulled up to vallet the car the bellhop informed us the lot was full and we will not be able to park at the hotel, (what???). Therefore we had to self park at a sketchy parking area near the hotel inbetween two huge building and lug our suitcases by ourselves to our room. Not the kind of service I would anticipate from an upscale property. Then we had to wait for the front desk to 'figure' out how their schedules were going to work and who was going to check in who prior to checking in - again horrible service. I would recommend staying away from this property if you expect top notch service. There are too many other properties you can stay at downtown Chicago for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, great service, was perfect for my trip.”
Reviews.Author: Loafinbaker
Reviews.Content: The Hotel 71 in Chicago is very well positioned near Wrigley Tower and on the River at Wabash street. It was easy walk to everywhere I needed to be. The room was clean, comfortable, and spacious. Bed was comfortable, and the heating and cooling system worked well. The bathroom was clean, shower was good with plenty of pressure. In room coffee was tasty, and the desk and wifi were a nice touch. The view of the river was great! As an added bonus, the windows open, so a little fresh air was a welcome thing, as the room did have the odor of smoke. (Hotel was full due to conventions in town. I was not able to get a non-smoking room) Overall the room was nice, however I do believe it had not been refurbished in a while. There was shoddy repair work from the removal of the in bathroom hairdryer, and some wallpaper was peeling. Once again, minor issues, but hopefully that will be rectified soon. Elevators were swift, and the doormen and front desk staff were very friendly, quick with several recommendations, and very attentive to any extra needs. It will be better when the full restaurant is back opened, instead of the bar area being only option. The Hotel 71 does get kudos for a good breakfast selection for grab and go! The modern design of the hotel is a nice break from the chains, and I found the lobby area inviting and comfortable. It was a good area to sit and read the paper, and watch the comings and goings as I waited for other members of my party. I will definitely stay at the Hotel 71 in Chicago again, should business take me there again! I would also use it for a pleasure trip, as it is in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware - Not as great as the lobby seems.”
Reviews.Author: tubgoddess
Reviews.Content: I did a TON of research before we went to Chicago for the weekend about hotels and where to stay in the city. This place had great reviews across the board so we tried it out. Unfortunately - that's the best part of this review. I called to make a reservation over the phone b/c i found a package online for a weekend away - where you get two nights with some other stuff included and 30% off one of the nights. I called b/c I wanted to be SURE that's the way the offer was. The girl assured me it was and proceeded to book me. However, once i got my email confirmation, she booked me on the wrong day. The cost was cheaper on that weekend but it was the wrong weekend. The reason i caught the incorrect booking is because they charged my credit card for a late fee since the weekend was in the past! Um HELLO! I tried to call and change the reservation and find out why they had charged my card and was put on hold for 15 minutes. I was pissed and hung up. Had my boyfriend call back b/c i would have been mean to them and he's way nice on the phone. He called up to change the reservation and they didn't apologize but booked it on the correct weekend. The price had gone up as well! We were leaving in two days so we decided to deal with it in person once we got to the hotel. When we arrived - the lobby was pretty cool but once we got to our room, it was nice but it certainly wasn't worth the price we paid for it. There was a HUGE crack in the tub and everything looked a bit rundown. No so happy about that. Once we were leaving and going to pay - the price was different than what i was quoted a few different times. It was different from the second email confirmation i received as well. Also, i we hadn't be charged for the 30% off the second night that i had SPECIFICALLY asked about over the phone. I asked the guy at the front desk who wasn't so hot to help me out either. Come on dude! I bet you were the one who put me on hold for 15 minutes! at least take my number down and call me back. I've worked in a serious industry and this is not the way to treat a customer. After questioning the bill again he brought up the offer online and proceeded to tell me that it was 30% off a second ROOM not a night. so freaking confusing. I was pissed but whatever. I just wanted to go home at this point. I will NOT be staying here again. This should be a BUYER BEWARE if you're going to be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel Loved Hotel 71”
Reviews.Author: LaurieD2009
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed in the premier king river view room was just awesome. The room was just gorgeous. Very clean and roomy, bathroom was huge and even had a tv in it not kidding was great. The shower had a rainforest shower head with room to spare big enough for 4. Lovely bathroom was huge. The view from the room was just amazing. The front desk was very helpful with any questions that we had. The doorman was very helpful as well always right there if you needed anything. Hotel 71 was close to all attractions we walked everywhere and felt safe no problems at all. Could not say enough about this hotel not sure about the standard rooms but ours was just beautiful even the hallways were very clean and well decorated. Also try Dicks last resort which is right across the river, atmosphere was just so much fun we had lots of laughs there the servers were just hillarious and food was good. Dicks is right on the river so the view again was great. This was our first time to Chicago and we had a blast. We would definetly go back again and stay at Hotel 71 not a bad thing about this hotel. Loved Hotel 71.

Reviews.Title: “A delight in the city”
Reviews.Author: sb631
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a long weekend. I was in fear when we were told at check in that the hotel oversold our room type. The desk clerk, Mike, quickly commented that this was their fault and he would have to make it right. We were upgraded to an executive suite. This was a huge two room suite. It spanned to both sides of the hotel. We were able to have a great city view on one side and an even better view of the river and lake on the other. The hotel is very conveniently located; right across the street from the River Walk and just two blocks from the CTA trains. We took the train rather than the $40 - 50 cab ride. We were glad we did. $2.50 each and about 30 minutes took us from the airport to the hotel, no traffic and more $ for the city. The hotel was clean, staff friendly, in the midst of great restaurants and all around wonderful. We had never been to Chicago and had a great time. Hotel 71 was a wonderful experience. Make sure you take an architectual river tour or you will miss some real gems in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Unorganized, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NomiaRiver
Reviews.Content: Had romantic, Valentine's package that was completely messed up. Scheduled to have rose petals and champagne in room and the hotel didn't do at scheduled time. They claimed someone was in the room showering, when we were clearly out of the hotel at dinner reservation. The staff was snobby and didn't believe me. They snapped at me on the phone. Parking cost was extortion. Rooms were very night and the bathroom was fantastic, but not sure these amenities are worth the nasty customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great girls weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: Meemuu
Reviews.Content: Weekend girls getaway - large room with 2 queens was perfect. Big bathroom and closets, plenty of floor space and great location. The staff could not have been nicer and they accomodated both a very early checkin and a delayed checkout. This will be the 1st choice for the next trip to Chicago and also 1st recommended to any who ask.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Texasteam
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 is the perfect place to stay when you want to be in the middle of all attractions. Nice big rooms, very clean, excellent Italien Restaurant next door, Coffee Place around the corner. Everything in walking distance. And we made an excellent deal to get a room with the perfect view.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be going back!”
Reviews.Author: Lmartensen
Reviews.Content: What an amazing find! Our room was amazing - awesome view of the river and in a prime location. I only hope the rates stay as competitive as we found for our stay here in July 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Awesome Trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: KyT27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 71 for 3 nights and we couldnt be happier. I chose this hotel after reading plenty of good reviews on tripadvisor, and they were right! We upgraded our room to the Premier King/River-view based on reviews I read and it was the right choice. The view from our room was beautiful, looking right down the Chicago River, definitely worth the $. The rooms were big, definitely plenty of space with lots of drawers, big closet, and bathroom. Loved the amenities like free wifi, TVs in room and bathroom, rain shower, fridge(on request) and doorbell for the room! The hotel is modern and very clean(I'm usually picky when it comes to that). The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is an excellent location and to go to any of the sightseeing activities was an $8 cab ride at the most. We went to pretty much every tourist attraction during our trip and I dont want to write too much on here about which are worth it and which ones aren't but definitely go on the River and Lake Boat Tour(90 mins), its right across the street and it was fantastic. There are several companies to choose from but we went on the Wendella for the night ride($23/person), its worth it. Overall I don't have one bad thing to say about this hotel, except maybe that if you have a car its a bit expensive for parking($43/night) so we did what another reviewer recommended, and parked in the Millennium Park Garage($24/night) about 3 blocks away. We didnt need the Jeep during our stay since we were right in the middle and close to everything, we either walked or took a cab. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: eljoe23
Reviews.Content: Hard to find much of anything to complain about here. The desk staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant, always greeting us as we returned to the hotel. Just had new carpet installed in the main lobby, which despite the "new carpet smell", was nice to see that they refresh the place a bit. Rooms were adequate, clean and well maintained. This isn't a luxury hotel, but in a luxury location that really can't be beat! If you're expecting something fancy, this isn't it. But if you're looking for a nice, clean room where you mostly intend to relax and sleep after a day of exploring the city, this is the place. Elevators were indeed slow at busier times. There are only 4 elevators, 2 serving the lower floors, 2 serving the upper floors. They were lightning fast once you got on, the only slowness was the wait occasionally, but never was more than 3-4 minutes for us. Not enough to frustrate us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: frequent_travler35
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our room. We booked through Perfect Escapes and got a free room upgrade to a remodeled room with a view of the river. When we checked in we were told we had a late checkout as part of our package and to call and tell them what time we wanted to checkout . When we called we were told late checkout was 1:00 and we would be charged $70 if we checked out later. I asked that they please tell people when they check in if there is a specific late checkout time and received a blank look from both the staff and manager who were standing at the counter. Others in our party (we had 5 rooms total) had similar experiences with the staff â€“ they just donâ€™t seem to care. A simple smile and â€˜ok Iâ€™ll pass that alongâ€™ was all I was looking for but apparently that was not part of the package. Nice hotel, good location but itâ€™s hard to get excited about a hotel when they treat customers with such disdain.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view & location!”
Reviews.Author: meganjessica
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed 4 nights for a first-time trip to Chicago and found Hotel 71 to be perfect for what we needed. If you can afford the upgrade, definitely book the Premium/River View level rooms. The riverside views from this hotel are beyond excellent, something you would expect to pay at least $400 a night for and we paid less than $200 through hotels.com. The Premium rooms are on the lower floors, but they are very nicely upgraded, spacious and cozily furnished. Bathrooms have marble, separate tub/shower and dual vanities. Our room was missing the mini-fridge and microwave that the description said would be there, but one phone call to the front desk and both were quickly brought up by the very friendly housekeeping. All of the staff is professional, friendly and non-obtrusive. Our room was spotlessly clean everyday. We also did not notice any noise from the rooms around us. We had zero trouble with the elevators and they came quickly every time. Located at Michigan/Wacker the hotel is two blocks from every train line and many major bus routes. In my opinion, I couldn't have chosen a better hotel, but that said, some travelers may not like a few things. This is not the hotel if you like a lavish restaurant, lobby, and having your hand-held by a concierge. There is an excellent Corner Bakery Cafe next door for breakfast, but only a tiny hotel restaurant. The staff is efficient and mostly invisible (my favorite), but if you want to be greeted a lot . . .you won't be. Perhaps most importantly, you really should request a room away from the elevators, they are older and creaky and you will hear them if your room is close by. Ice is not on every floor, but is easy and generous (extra buckets are stored by the machine). There may be some street noise, but you are in the absolute heart of an enormous city and should expect it. . . bring earplugs. I have traveled quite a bit and think this hotel is actually underrated and nicer than many trendier more expensive places have been, and I've also never had a better location and view for a first trip to a city. We really enjoyed our trip to Chicago and Hotel 71 was a big part of what was good about it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, price, staff this place is the real deal!”
Reviews.Author: napermom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to help celebrate my 40th with my sisters. It is in the heart of the hospitality center of the city and it was perfect! The location cannot be beat- river view, the staff acted like old friends, and the price could not be beat. The service in the hotel was fast, exceedingly friendly and perfect! I will be staying here again on my next visit! Plus the linens, shower and seperate bath- was such a treat- nothing like I would have at home!

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: delylah2
Reviews.Content: great location, great price on rooms via expedia big room helpful and friendly staff

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, beautiful views, great location”
Reviews.Author: KKCharile
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have stayed in this hotel in several different rooms, the first room was a suite and it was fabulous, the second was one of the more expensive rooms with the most beautiful bathroom, very clean and very spacious. The third stay was just a regular room, and it was still very nice and spacious and clean, overall a great hotel to stay in no matter what your budget. There are also a handful of wonderful restaurants within walking distance, and the views from the hotel are beautiful as it looks over the river and other gorgeous buildings. It is near Michigan Ave. so great shopping is within walking distance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: LisaB16
Reviews.Content: I would go back in the future. There was nice staff and very helpful. Very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Divehigirl
Reviews.Content: The view is breathtaking, and just a stone's throw from Michigan avenue. The room was very large, and so was the bathroom, which was very pleasant. Good value for money, I would return there without hesitating.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: MItraveler59
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel thru EasyClick.com. Asked for a river view room and was given one on the 32nd floor. The river views are fantastic. Also looked directly on Trump Tower, Wrigley Building and could see John Hancock. The room was clean and neat. The bed was very comfortable. Had an older tv, but was not there to watch tv. A window that opens was a plus for me. Nice to be able to do that and hear the sounds of the city. Unfortunately, as others have stated, there were elevator issues again. The first day, they were fine but after that, one elevator and long waits. My major complaint was the loud banging that happened both nights at 1 a.m. Not sure where it came from. Also, housecleaning staff would let the door to linen closet slam shut. Minor annoyance, but still annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: mlr5601
Reviews.Content: Hotel 71 was ideally located just off Michigan Ave and located near many great Chicago attractions. The hotel was vey clean and our room, with two queen beds was very spacious with a great view of the Chicago River. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT view, location, value - fun room,”
Reviews.Author: Rsroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel 71 in May 2009 and booked the least expensive room because of a fantastic promo rate direct from their website. I was expecting just a small, kind of boring, but conveniently located room. I was also a little concerned about some of the poor reviews. We were VERY spleasantly surprised! We got a "back" view room" but it was on the outside corner of the 26th floor so it had huge windows on 2 sides and you could see the river. I don't think the other "back rooms" would have this spectacular view. Very sunny, pleasant, and decorated kind of funky - different than most boring chains. It had obvioulsy just been decorated. Close to Millenium Park, and the River Architectual tour was a block away. (highly recommend) We also took the architectual walking tour around the area. (it's FREE! -they won't even accept tips! highly recommend) We took the Amtrak to Chicago - it's a pleasant 15+ min walk or a $7-$8 cab ride. I think some of the reviews must have been written before the renovation was completed, because when we stayed, all elevators were working and everything seemed fine. Not a lot of nightlife directly in the area, but cabs were inexpensive and the staff was helpful getting cabs, and directing to public transport, etc. We didn't have time for the fitness center, but did look at it - it was on the top floor (great view) and might inspire you to actually use it. No restaurant in hotel, but a good breakfast place next door. I would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Went through all my things and the worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveleroften
Reviews.Content: Never stay here if you want your privacy and belongs to be safe. We went to lunch and came back to have been locked out of our room. Someone had come into our room, packed all our clothes in a crumbled mess, and touched our clean underware to place our things into another room with duck tape on the windows, and no tub or upgrades, and already had another family checked into our nicer room without our knowledge or permission. We felt completed disregarded and disrespected for having a discounted room rate. We were only entitled to the worst room in house since they were sold out, and refered to some inkeepers law, saying they did it all the time. We felt completely violated that they some stranger had handled all our new purchases, and clean clothes, and threw our shoes in bags with our night clothes. Don't ever stay here!!!!! It was a nightmare, and they talked down to us, and were rude and horrible! The rooms are dirty, and moldy, and the shower had water above our ankles. Don't let the new lobby fool you. They are young and arogant, and completely unprofessional in their services. I am horrified by the experience, and my handbag was still in the room with the new occupants enjoying our view and room. If it is the last hotel in Chicago, go north, but don't stay in this scary place! Just beware.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we booked”
Reviews.Author: cloudsurferToronto
Reviews.Content: Room was not as booked or advertised. Worst part was that the manager was not helpful at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sininen
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel 71 for six nights on a business trip. Our travel agent presented us several choices for accommodation and we picked this one based on the information and the photos on the hotel's website. Not a good choice, I was quite disappointed with the hotel. Location was good but not excellent, though right in the city center. View from the room was good but not spectacular. Room was ok but far from luxury. Lot of space but bit strangely and uncomfortably arranged. Bathroom was good size but the bath was tiny with sides only about 30 cm high so it was not possible to have a bath. Bed and pillow were clumby and to my great disappointement no duvet but sheets with wool blanket. Old tv with bad reception. No minibar, also really disappointing. Surprisingly quite a lot of noice from the street when staying high up, but more disturbing was the noise from the corridor and neighbouring rooms. Not a luxury boutique hotel, just basic American business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine if you're on a budget”
Reviews.Author: dany2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived in Chicago for four years, so when we went back recently to visit friends for a weekend, we weren't concerned with getting a top-of-the-line hotel to experience the city from. We wanted a good location, a comfortable room, and that was about it. We found a great deal at Hotel 71 through Easyclicktravel.com and found that the TripAdvisor reviews we'd read about the hotel were fairly accurate. We checked in late on a Friday night due to a delayed flight. The man working the reception desk seemed a little spacey and first gave us a key to an occupied room--we went up there with our luggage and opened the door to find it chained and the TV on inside! We went back to the front desk to request a second room--this time we got a smoking room after we had requested nonsmoking. Finally, the 3rd room they gave us fit the bill. The chaos upon check-in is the one true complaint I have about Hotel 71. The room was clean and comfortable and a great deal for the price we paid. The tub in the bathroom did drain a bit slowly, but not enough to bother us. The staff were all kind and attentive and the location truly can't be beat. I think my husband summed it up best by saying that the Hotel 71 is a hotel that probably used to be really great, but has languished a bit over the years and could use a little TLC. For the price we paid, though (about $115 a night), we felt we got a great deal of value for our money. If you are planning your first trip to Chicago, though, I would recommend not going with the Hotel 71 just to save money--splurge on a nicer hotel in the same River North area and enjoy your experience in the city!

Reviews.Title: “great location - ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeco2006
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location which means you can walk to most of Chicago's major attractions like Mag Mile, Navy Pier, Millennium Park, Loop, State Street. There are also subway stations close by to reach attractions more far away. From O'Hare airport we took the blue line subway to the downtown station Clark/Lake for $2.25 ea. and then had a 5 minute-walk to the hotel. The hotel itself is an older building which you can tell from the interior. There are old doors and old cabinets inside the rooms.The hotel offers little service, no ice, no restaurants, no vending machines. Still, the staff is very friendly, safes are available in the reception office and the rooms are clean, have TV, stereo, a clean bathroom. Another plus: Free Wi-Fi in the room. Rooms appaer a bit dark as they have dark rugs and furniture. We recommend the Corner Bakery next door for meals. We would stay again for location but not really because the hotel is so great.

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice, but could use some touch-up repairs.”
Reviews.Author: mrscfuller
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to Chicago on many occasions. I decided to stay at a different area closer to Michigan Av. I chose Hotel 71. The staff was very nice. The out side and the hotel lobby was okay. But once I got to our room, i was kind of disappointed. the hotel room was not as nice as the picture that they showed. The room itself was clean but it was the little details that where not right. For instance, the tub and shower needed some work the shower handles and knobs where loose and out of place. The tub looked like it had been painted and the paint was wearing off. The old staines where coming through. Also when i wen to turn down the bed, there was no fitted mattress sheets on the bed they just took a regular sheet and covered the mattress with it. After the first night we got up early that morning and went out for the day . We did not return until about four o'clock that evening and our room had not yet been cleaned . Even though the staff was very nice, I was not impressed by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Stay for a Girl's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1006
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at this hotel the night of June 27th for my birthday/girl's weekend. There was 6 of us total. I booked off of easyclicktravel.com and got a really good deal. We took the Amtrak and Union Station was not far from the hotel. The rooms were VERY spacious and clean. I also requested a connecting/adjoining room and we got that with no problems. We were also given an early check-in and upgraded to river view rooms when I only booked a city view room. The views from all of our windows was AWESOME! It was also nice that they opened. The location of this hotel was very nice also. It's about a 1 1/2blks from MI Ave. We also went to the The Roof which is a lounge bar at the Wit Hotel. It was walking distance. Some other bars that we went to, we had to take a cab but it was no more than $8 or so. As some other people mention it is also right around the corner from The Corner Bakery which has very good breakfast, but get there early cause it gets crowded (we went around 10a) My only complaint were the elevators. I had read about that in some of the reviews listed but I also read that the problem had been fixed...I couldn't tell. It wouldn't prevent me from staying here but it's just something to know.

Reviews.Title: “TOP HOTEL AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: oldben070
Reviews.Content: Harry Aylward, Portsmouth, UK Was apprehensive about staying here after reading reviews.All the negative review points have been actioned by the staff.No complaints on that at all.The location was perfect,right on the river ,10 mins walk to the lake and 5 mins from the magnificent mile for shops.Plenty of good eating places within 10 mins walk.Upgraded to a river view room and was well worth it.The room was large enough for a whole family of 6.Booked one month in advance on the internet and obtained a good discount.Would stay again if in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: dandd284
Reviews.Content: Great location, very clean, and helpful staff. What more can I say?

Reviews.Title: “Modern and great location!”
Reviews.Author: tcjewell
Reviews.Content: Staff was very helpful and friendly. The view was excellent and the location was right in the thick of Chicago! Rooms were large and comfortable. Free wireless internet. The only down side was parking at the hotel was $43/night! We ended up parking about three blocks away at Millennium Park garage for $25/night. Chicago traffic was bad, so if you are going to stay downtown, don't even bother with a car. This hotel was within walking distance to just about everything!

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Blain80
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, rooms are modern very stylish. Location is ok, staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: azsundevil30
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel 71 over Thanksgiving weekend during a visit to Chicago with my wife. Made our reservations through Hotwire, so got it at a discounted rate. Honestly was a bit apprehensive after some of the reviews, but it ended up being a great stay. They seem to have addressed the elevator issue that people have complained about (we never waited more than a minute or two for the elevator (we were on the 36th floor)). The room was clean and comfortable, although the bathroom fixtures could use some updating. The staff was polite and more than accomodating. The location was absolutely perfect. Literally a few minutes walk from many chicago attractions including the theater district, miracle mile, rush street and many of the museums and restaurants. My wife and I would absolutely stay here again without hestitation.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep, etc.”
Reviews.Author: split2991
Reviews.Content: I got "upgraded" to a remodeled room, #1601. Right next to the elevator, and the noises kept me up all night (and usually I have no trouble sleeping). Internet amazingly slow to the point of being unworkable. No ethernet cable to back up the wireless access. Very poor entertainment options. Colleague found a dirty sock under her bed, also found internet access unworkable, had a dripping faucet, and had a used bar of soap in her bathroom- Yech. I stayed here last year and it was ok, but I'm not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Can only recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: TriBabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the 71 for the Chicago marathon from Oct. 9-15 in 2008. We booked online through lastminute.com already in February and received a really good rate considering the period - marathon times are always crazy. They upgraded us to a riverview room in the 28th floor, gorgeous views. Location is ideal, close to magnificent mile, Navy Pier and downtown - all in walking distance. You can tell from the bathtub and the wallpaper that it's not a new hotel, but the rooms are really big and very nice. Staff is ok although not over-friendly. There's no restaurant at all, they have roomservice and a very good corner bakery cafe right next to the hotel, very convenient for breakfast. Only downside are the elevators - from the 2 going up to our floor only one was working for the entire period, and this one got stuck on the last day of our stay, which meant everybody had to take the service elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to be redone”
Reviews.Author: jeonyc
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel on Hotwire-3 and a half stars at 189 a night. All of the reviews are right. The carpet of the lobby is absolutely filthy gross. Elevators are bizarre and you do have to wait. The hallways reek of some kind of fragrance to cover up some major stale smell. The rooms are beat up. Furniture in rooms looks like people have bashed their suitcases into it for about 6 years. The paint is peeling off and the carpeting, albeit new, looks like it was the cheapest option possible. This is certainly NOT a three and a half star. I even wrote to Hotwire asking them to rethink offering this hotel to customers. It is depressing, weird and absolutely not kept up! Stay somewhere else!
